circulatim: <entryFree id="n8114" type="main" key="circu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>circulor</etym>, <sense id="n8114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a circle</hi> (post-Aug. and rare). </sense><sense id="n8114.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectori circulatim cerotaria apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:153" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl> Gronov. (Büch circumlatum).—</sense><sense id="n8114.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">in circles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groups</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">companies</hi>: multitudo circulatim suo quaeque more lamentata est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
circulatio: <entryFree id="n8115" type="hapax" key="circu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circular course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circulator: <entryFree id="n8116" type="main" key="circu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8116.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pedler</hi>: auctionum, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8116.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountebank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl>; Petr 68, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 38</bibl>.—Of noisy philosophers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 5</bibl></sense></entryFree>
circulatorius: <entryFree id="n8117" type="main" key="circu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circulator</etym>, <sense id="n8117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a mountebank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quackish</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">jactatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volubilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestigiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circulatrix: <entryFree id="n8118" type="main" key="circu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female mountebank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stroller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 18, 1</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>of a mountebank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circulo: <entryFree id="n8119" type="main" key="circu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post - class. collat. <cb n="CIRC" /> form of circulor) [circulus], <sense id="n8119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make circu lar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, App. flor. 9, p. 346, 21. circulatus gressus, Cael. Aur Tard. 1, 1: digitos. <hi rend="ital">bent in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 89, p. 330</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8119.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verticem varietatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, § 831</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, § 333 al.</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 269.</sense></entryFree>
circulor: <entryFree id="n8120" type="main" key="circu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8120.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To form a circle</hi> (of men) <hi rend="ital">about one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to gather in a company</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circle for conversation</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 54, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis vero castris milites circulari et dolere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8120.1" n="II" level="1"> Of mountebanks, <hi rend="ital">to collect people around one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:52:7" default="NO">52, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circulus: <entryFree id="n8121" type="main" key="circu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">circlus</orth>, like vinclum = vinculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 166</bibl>) [kindred with <foreign lang="greek">ki/rkos, ku/klos</foreign>, circinus], <sense id="n8121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circular figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>: circulus aut orbis, qui <foreign lang="greek">ku/klos</foreign> Graece dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri exterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus ad speciem caelestis arcūs orbem solis ambiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8121.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8121.2" n="1" level="3"> In astronomy, <hi rend="ital">a circular course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orbit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae circulos suos orbesque conficiunt celeritate mirabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctialis, solstitialis, septentrionalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 516</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacteus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Milky Way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:230" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 29, 69, § 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8121.3" n="2" level="3"> In geog., <hi rend="ital">a zone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belt</hi> of the eartb's surface: <cit><quote lang="la">plura sunt segmenta mundi, quae nostri circulos appellavere, Graeci parallelos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n8121.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of time: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis artiore praecingitur circulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8121.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8121.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any circular body; a ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necklace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8121.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A circle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">company for social intercourse</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in conviviis rodunt, in circulis vellicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with convivia also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 61, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 22, 8</bibl>; Domit. Mars. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:5" default="NO">10, 62, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cir culos aliquos et sessiunculas consectarl,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl></cit> per fora et circulos locuti sunt, Tac Agr 43; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemcumque patrem familias arripuissetis ex aliquo circulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de circulo se subducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw from the assembly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12</bibl> 10; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">densa circumstantium corona latissimum judicium multiplici circulo ambibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ep 6:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep 6, 33, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circum: <entryFree id="n8122" type="main" key="circum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum</orth> <etym>properly <case>acc.</case> from circus = <foreign lang="greek">ki/rkos</foreign></etym>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos>, designates either an entire encompassing or surrounding of an object, or a proximity only partially em. bracing or comprehending it, <sense id="n8122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all around</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">peri/, a)mfi/</foreign> </sense><sense id="n8122.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8122.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all around</hi>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">pe/ric</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcas circum offigito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Verg A 3, 230: quia (locus) vastis circum saltibus claudebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli circum est ansas amplexus acantho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age tu interim Da cito ab Delphio Cantharum circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae circum essent opera tueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. C 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea Rutuli portis circum omnibus instant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 118</bibl></cit> (i. e. circumcirca fusi: <cit><quote lang="la">nam modo circum adverbium loci est, Serv.): omnem, quae nuno .umida circum Caligat, nu. bem eripiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 605</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:11" default="NO">1, 5, 11</bibl>. sed circum tutae sub moenibus urbis aquantur, <hi rend="ital">round about under the walls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 4, 193</bibl>. faciundum haras quadratas circum binos pedes, <hi rend="ital">all around</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on every side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 3</bibl> Schneid.—</sense><sense id="n8122.3" n="b" level="4"> Strengthened with undique (in later Latin also sometimes written as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumundique</orth>), <hi rend="ital">from everywhere around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around on all sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum Undique convenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 416</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 404</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausis circum undique portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositu circumundique aliarum aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:1" default="NO">13, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:9" default="NO">14, 2, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with totus and omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8122.4" n="B" level="2"> Of an incomplete circuit, esp. of the part that meets the view, lies on the hither side, etc. (v. under II.): <cit><quote lang="la">hostilibus circum litoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas... aperto circum pelago peramoena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentibus innumeris circum infraque relictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 668</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus servans circumque supraque vertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 9, 114</bibl></cit>; Albin. Carm. ap. Maecen. 46. <cb n="CIRC" /></sense><sense id="n8122.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n8122.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abow</hi> (implying a complete circuit): <cit><quote lang="la">armillas quattuor facito, quas circum orbem indas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra circum axem se summā celeritate convertit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 19</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligato circum collum sudario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque novas circum felix eat hostia fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at genitor circum caput omne micantes Deposuit radios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8122.7" n="B" level="2"> As in <pos>adv.</pos> B., of an incomplete circuit, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus sparsus, promissus, circum caput Rejectus neglegenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexo circum cava tempora cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 313</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Salii ad cantus incensa altaria circum adsunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios hic flumina circum Fundit humus flores,</quote> <trans><tr>on the borders of the rivulets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgeris turbā circum te stante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum renidentes Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 484</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 557</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi indignantes Circum claustra fremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras et litora circum errantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8122.8" n="C" level="2"> Circum very freq. expresses, not a relative motion around a given central point, but an absol. circular movement, in which several objects named form separate points of a periphery, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among... around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to... around</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">te adloquor, Quae circum vicinos vages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: ego Arpini volo esse pridie Cal., deinde circum villulas nostras errare, not <hi rend="ital">round about our villas</hi>, but <hi rend="ital">in our villas around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Naevius pueros circum amicos dimittit,</quote> <trans><tr>to friends around</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praetorem circum omnia fora sectaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apronius ducebat eos circum civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">65: ille circum hospites cursabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">41: lenonem quondam Lentuli concursare circum tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissis circum municipia litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum oram maritimam misit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatio sub idem tempus in Asiam et circum insulas missa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 45, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 1, 1, 49</bibl>: et te circum omnes alias irata puellas Differet, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among all the other maidens around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 21</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n8122.9" n="D" level="2"> With the prevailing idea of neighborhood, vicinity, <hi rend="ital">in the environs of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum haec loca commorabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; Pompei <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 12</bibl>, C, 1 exercitu in foro et in omnibus templis, quae circum forum sunt, conlocato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes, quae circum Capuam sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot essent circum hastam illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit> Wernsd. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non succurrit tibi, quamdiu circum Bactra haereas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8122.10" n="E" level="2"> Of persons who surround one (as attendants, friends, etc.); in Gr.<foreign lang="greek">peri</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/ tina</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucae, quae circum illam essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium flagitiorum atque facinorum circum se tamquam stipatorum catervas habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hectora circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 166</bibl></cit>.—Circum pedes for ad pedes, of servants in attendance, is rare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v ad, I. D. 3. b.—!*? Circum is sometimes placed after its subst.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 31</bibl></cit> Müll., Lucr 1, 937; 4, 220; 6, 427; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 515</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 564</bibl>; 3, 75: 6, 166; 6, 329; 9, 440; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:51" default="NO">1, 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:395" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 395</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8122.11" n="III" level="1"> In composition the <hi rend="ital">m</hi> remains unchanged before consonants; before vowels it was, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 567</bibl> P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2294</bibl> ib., written in like manner, but (except before <hi rend="ital">j</hi> and <hi rend="ital">v</hi>) not pronounced. Yet in the best MSS. we find the orthography circuitio, circuitus, and even circueo together with circumeo; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 736 sq. —Signif., </sense><sense id="n8122.12" n="a" level="4"> Acc. to II. A.: circumcido, circumcludo, circumculco, circumfluo, circumfodio, circumfundo, etc.—</sense><sense id="n8122.13" n="b" level="4"> Acc. to II. B.: circumcolo, circumflecto, circumjaceo, circumicio.—</sense><sense id="n8122.14" n="c" level="4"> Acc. to II. C.: circumcellio, circumcurso, circumduco, circumfero, circumforaneus.—In many compounds, circum has sometimes one and sometimes another signif., as in circumdo, circumeo, circumsisto, etc.; v. h. vv.—!*? With verbs compounded with circum, this preposition is never repeated before the following<pb n="336" /> <cb n="CIRC" />  object; e. g. circumcursare circum aliquid and similar phrases are not found.</sense></entryFree>
circumactio: <entryFree id="n8123" type="main" key="circumacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumago</etym>. <sense id="n8123.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a turning around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 885</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8123.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">a turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumactus: <entryFree id="n8124" type="main" key="circumactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from circumago, q. v. <sense id="n8124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8125" type="main" key="circumactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumago</etym>, <sense id="n8125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning round</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumaggero: <entryFree id="n8126" type="main" key="circumagge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-aggĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n8126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to heap up around</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimo radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumago: <entryFree id="n8127" type="main" key="circuma^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ăgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8127.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn round</hi> (most freq. since the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Quint.): impera suovetaurilia circumagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 1</bibl></cit>.—And with two <case>acc.</case> (on account of circum): <cit><quote lang="la">terram fundumque meum suovetaurilia circumagi jussi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(annus) qui solstitiali circumagitur orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleonis oculos ipsos circumagi totos tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 152</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> in mid. sense (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Aegeum pelagus summotas terras hinc ad promunturium, quod Sunium vocatur, magno ambitu mollique circumagit,</quote> <trans><tr>rolls around</tr>, <tr>surrounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce by going around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinctis bobus ... aratro circumagebant sulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8127.2" n="B" level="2"> T. t., to manumit a slave <hi rend="ital">by turning him round.</hi> since the slave, in such a case, was taken by his master with the right hand, and turned around in a circle (cf. vertigo, Casaub. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:75 sq" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 75 sq.</bibl>, and Dict. of Antiq.); <cit><quote lang="la">fig.: qui se illi (philosophiae) subjecit et tradidit, statim circumagitur: hoc enim ipsum philosophiae servire libertas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8127.4" n="1" level="3"> Of time, with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or more freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be spent</hi> (so most freq. in <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi> and in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso conatu rerum circumegit se annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed prius se aestas circumegit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius circumactus est annus, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumactis decem et octo mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 40, 1</bibl>; 27, 30, 11; 44, 36, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 17, § 76</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in tmesis: circum tribus actis annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 881</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">temp. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus, qui solstitiali circumagitur orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis in apparatu ipso annus circumagitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the vicissitudes of fortune, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videamus tot varietates tam volubili orbe circumagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheel around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:14 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 14 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum in aversam se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad dissonos clamores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumagitur, cum venit, imago (in speculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 316</bibl></cit> (340): <cit><quote lang="la">circumagente se vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui (milites) ultimi stabant... verti tamen et in frontem circumagi possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:220" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 41, 80, § 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <trans><tr>to lead back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>. —Hence, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumagetur hic orbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the tide will turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">' praecipua cenationum rotunda, quae perpetuo diebus ac noctibus vice mundi circumageretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., to agitate, disturb: <cit><quote lang="la">verna (mala) stomacho inutilia sunt, alvom, vesicam circumagunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 54, § 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic paululum circumacta fortuna est,</quote> <trans><tr>changes</tr>, <tr>is changed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed unā voce, quā Quirites eos pro militibus appellarat, tam facile circumegit et flexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo te circumagas?</quote> <trans><tr>whither will you now turn?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universum prope humanum genus circumegit in se,</quote> <trans><tr>brought over to his side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.9" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to circum, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">To run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drive about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed from one place to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(milites) huc illuc clamoribus hostium circumagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: nil opus est te Circumagi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that you wander about with me</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8127.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pendere ex alterius vultu ac nutu, nec alieni momentis animi circumagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumoribus vulgi circumagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 34</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CIRC" /> 4; 26, 8, 3.—</sense><sense id="n8127.11" n="IV" level="1"> Aliquem aliquā re = circumdare, <hi rend="ital">to surround with something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem Saturnum muro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">bent around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi> (perh. only in the two Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">in orbem circumactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:146" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 34, 62, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim circumactis curvatisque litoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumambulo: <entryFree id="n8128" type="hapax" key="circumambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to walk around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes glebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 3, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumamictus: <entryFree id="n8129" type="main" key="circuma^mictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ămictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amicio</etym>, <sense id="n8129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enveloped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invested</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumaro: <entryFree id="n8130" type="main" key="circuma^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ăro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcaesura: <entryFree id="n8131" type="main" key="circumcaesu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-caesūra</orth>, <itype>or separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-cum caesūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the external contour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outline</hi> ( = circumscriptio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:645" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 645</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcalco: <entryFree id="n8132" type="main" key="circumcalco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-calco</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-cumculco</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trample upon all around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:21:section=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 21, § 8</bibl>: terminos, Sicul. Flac. p. 6.</sense></entryFree>
circumcellio: <entryFree id="n8133" type="main" key="Circumcelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circumcellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cella</etym>. <sense id="n8133.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A class of monks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without fixed abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandered about from cell to cell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 132" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A class of heretics</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcidaneus: <entryFree id="n8134" type="main" key="circumci_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumcīdo</etym>, prop., <sense id="n8134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from cutting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paring around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <trans><tr>wine pressed out after the ordinary pressing</tr>, <tr>when the husks and stems remaining in the press had been cut around</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same, called mustum circumcisicium or circumcisitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcido: <entryFree id="n8135" type="main" key="circumci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n8135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi> (orig. in agriculture; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: amputo, reseco): ars agricolarum, quae circumcidat, amputet, erigat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam acuto scalpello circumcidito... ejusdem spatii corticem circumcidito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 26, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO">12, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera scrobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ad medullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caespitem gladiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitalia (Judaeorum),</quote> <trans><tr>to circumcise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8135.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumscribe</hi> (very freq. in prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: amputo, reseco, demo, aufero): testatur saepe Chrysippus, tres solas esse sententias, quae defendi possint, de finibus bonorum: circumcidit et amputat multitudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 138</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with amputo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus circumcisi aut sublati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">impensam funeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:19:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 19, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisā omni negotiosā actione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcidendum vinum est in totum annum,</quote> <trans><tr>to be abstained from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to lop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisis rebus, quae non arbitror pertinere ad agriculturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcidat, si quid redundabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:42" default="NO">4, 2, 42</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) rotunda et undique circumcisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:104" default="NO">10, 1, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptas quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-cumcīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">cut off around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n8135.2" n="A" level="2"> Of localities = abscisus, abruptus, <hi rend="ital">cut off from connection with the region around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Henna ab omni aditu circumcisa atque directa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ex omni parte circumcisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8135.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">abridged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi> (so prob. not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim tam circumcisum, tam breve, quam hominis vita longissima?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisae orationes et breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ante oculos ponere circumcise atque velociter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcingo: <entryFree id="n8136" type="main" key="circumcingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-cingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enclose around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā Mons Apenninus regiones Italiae Etruriaeque circumcingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum zonā gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PORTICVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4043</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis circumcingentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcirca: <entryFree id="n8137" type="main" key="circumcirca_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-circā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a strengthened <cb n="CIRC" /> circum or circa, <sense id="n8137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all around</hi> (cf. the Heb. <foreign /> <foreign />, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 40, 5</bibl>; the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi\ teri/</foreign>; and our <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>—very rare, perh. only in the foll. exs.; and acc. to Serg. ap. Don. p. 1855 P. also in Cato): ubi erat haec defossa, occoepit scalpturire ibi ungulis circumcirca, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 9</bibl>: coepi regiones circumcirca prospicere, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 41; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 989 sq.</bibl> P.; Serg. ap. Don. 1. 1.; Hand, Turs. II. p. 73.</sense></entryFree>
circumcirco: <entryFree id="n8138" type="main" key="circumcirco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcirco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = circumeo, <sense id="n8138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 23</bibl></cit> Eyssenh.; dub. (al. circumcurrunt).</sense></entryFree>
circumcise: <entryFree id="n8139" type="main" key="circumci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. circumcido, <sense id="n8139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumcisicius: <entryFree id="n8140" type="main" key="circumci_sicius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsicius</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>, v. circumcidaneus.</entryFree>
circumcisio: <entryFree id="n8141" type="main" key="circumci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumcido</etym>, <sense id="n8141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumcision</hi>, physical and moral (only in eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">carnis, cordis, spiritūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
circumcisorium: <entryFree id="n8142" type="hapax" key="circumci_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for cutting around</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 26, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcisura: <entryFree id="n8143" type="hapax" key="circumci_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcisus: <entryFree id="n8144" type="main" key="circumci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>circumcido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
circumclamo: <entryFree id="n8145" type="main" key="circumcla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roar around</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the raging waves: <cit><quote lang="la">ora circumclamata procellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 506</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumclaudo: <entryFree id="n8146" type="main" key="circumclaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-claudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass. collat. form of circumcludo), <sense id="n8146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinā circumclaudendus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7:103" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcludo: <entryFree id="n8147" type="main" key="circumclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, <sense id="n8147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose on every side</hi> (in good class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ne duobus circumcluderetur exercitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Hisp. 6: cornua ab labris argento,</quote> <trans><tr>to surround with a rim of silver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 344</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">SEPVLCRVM MACERIIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4349</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8147.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Catilina consiliis, laboribus, periculis meis circumclusus ac debilitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>hemmed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suis praesidiis, suā diligentiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 51, 1</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
circumcola: <entryFree id="n8148" type="hapax" key="circumco^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>circumcolo</etym>, <sense id="n8148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwelling around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
circumcolo: <entryFree id="n8149" type="main" key="circumco^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-cŏlo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dwell round about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 12, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:13:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazones circumcolunt Tanain,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 8, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcordialis: <entryFree id="n8150" type="main" key="circumcordi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-cordĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">around the heart</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">calor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumculco: <entryFree id="n8151" type="main" key="circumculco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumculco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. circumcalco.</entryFree>
circumcumulo: <entryFree id="n8152" type="main" key="circumcu^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-cŭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pile up around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimes circumcumulantur acervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:655" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 655</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcurro: <entryFree id="n8153" type="main" key="circumcurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-curro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcurrens linea,</quote> <trans><tr>the periphery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8153.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam artem (rhetoricen) circumcurrentem vocaverunt. quod in omni materiā diceret,</quote> <trans><tr>universal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcursio: <entryFree id="n8154" type="main" key="circumcursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumcursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumcurro</etym>, <sense id="n8154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running around</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumcurso: <entryFree id="n8155" type="main" key="circumcurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-curso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run about in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">near something</hi> (ante- and post-class.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl>, more recent editt. read concursare); <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: omnia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 4</bibl>: aliquam hinc illinc, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 133</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: hac illac, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria versari et circumcursare columnae... uti pueris videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes portas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit> (in paraphr. of Cic.).</sense></entryFree>
circumdatio: <entryFree id="n8156" type="main" key="circumda^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumdătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumdo</etym>, <sense id="n8156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the putting around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
circumdo: <entryFree id="n8157" type="main" key="circumdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-do</orth>, <itype>dĕdi, dătum, dăre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit. <sense id="n8157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place around</hi>, i. e. both <hi rend="ital">to wrap around</hi> (e. g. a mantle). and also <hi rend="ital">to enclose</hi> (e. g. a town with a wall; syn.: cingo, vestio, saepio, circumvallo al.), with a twofold construction (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § 418). </sense><sense id="n8157.1" n="I" level="1"> Aliquid (alicui rei), <hi rend="ital">to place something<pb n="337" /> <cb n="CIRC" />  around something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set around</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8157.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër omnibus est rebus circumdatus appositusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1035" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1035</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus subjectos prope jam ignes circumdatosque restinximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdare fossam latam cubiculari lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satellites armatos contioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc patre hinc Catulo lateri circumdatis, Romam rediit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 28, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licia tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:459" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 459</bibl></cit>; 9, 605; 6, 479; <cit><quote lang="la">and in tmesis: collo dare bracchia circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 700</bibl></cit> (cf. the simplex: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia cervici dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">lectis aulaea purpura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maxime in hostiam itineri nostro circumdatam intuens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>divided</tr>, <tr>and part placed on each side of the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8157.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere januam saxis, ligna et sarmenta circumdare ignemque subicere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armata circumdatur Romana legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu circumdato summā vi Cirtam irrumpere nititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdatae stationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus circumdatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris toto opere circumdedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdato vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauream (sc. capiti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumdăti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the surrounding soldiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdatos Antonius adloquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—With an <case>abl.</case> loci: <cit><quote lang="la">toto oppido munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; and without <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdare terram radices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and per tmesin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8157.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (most freq. in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">cancelli, quos mihi ipse circumdedi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio an majora vincula majoresque necessitates vobis quam captivis vestris fortuna circumdederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiam famam paci circumdedit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>conferred</tr>, <tr>imparted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principatus inanem ei famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principi ministeria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">infula virgineos circumdata comptus,</quote> <trans><tr>encompassing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8157.5" n="II" level="1"> Aliquem or aliquid (aliquā re), <hi rend="ital">to surround some person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with something</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle with.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8157.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8157.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum (deus) circumdedit corpore et vestivit extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aether corpore concreto circumdatus undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio insulis circumdata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam domum spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallo castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonem vexillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canibus saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdato me bracchiis: meum collum circumplecte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aurum) circumdatum argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl></cit>: furvis circumdatus alis Somnus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad talos stola demissa et circumdata palla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdedit se zonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdata corpus amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 313</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:666" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 666</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora vittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:643" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sidoniam picto chlamydem circumdata limbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8157.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of a hostile surrounding, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum vallo et fossā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum quinis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum legati ... multitudine domum ejus circumdedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallo atque fossā moenia circumdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (hostes) primo Camillus vallo circumdare est adortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossā valloque urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossā duplicique vallo circumdatā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes exercitu toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8157.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni autem totam figuram mundi levitate circumdedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguis quibusdam finibus oratoris munus circumdedisti,</quote> <trans><tr>have confined</tr>, <tr>circumscribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minus octoginta annis circumdatum aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueritiam robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 134</bibl></cit>;
