cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:477" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrorum novitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumdoleo: <entryFree id="n8158" type="hapax" key="circumdo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-dŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi> <cb n="CIRC" /> <hi rend="ital">on every side</hi>: spiratio circumdolens; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to Forcellini: circum, seu undique, vel ab omni parte angens,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>very painful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14:92" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 14, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumdolo: <entryFree id="n8159" type="main" key="circumdo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-dŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hew off around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8159.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, tamquam bonus animi faber, vitia nostra circumdolat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumduco: <entryFree id="n8160" type="main" key="circumdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n8160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> circumduce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 66</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw around</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in milit. lang.; in Cic. perh. only once). </sense><sense id="n8160.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumduce exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles aliquo circumducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor cohortibus longiore itinere circumductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas ad latus Samnitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen per invia circa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars devio saltu circumducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 24, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captos Vitellii exploratores circumductos, ut robora exercitus noscerent, remittendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem per totam civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141</bibl></cit>.— Also like the simple verb <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter castra hostium circumducit,</quote> <trans><tr>marches around</tr>, <tr>avoids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vicatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per coetus epulantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam per organa hydraulica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>. —With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho istum, puer, circumduce hasce aedis et conclavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Pompeius... omnia sua praesidia circumduxit atque ostentavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61</bibl></cit> Kraner ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:517 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 517 sq.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">And in tmesis: circum in quaestus ducere Asinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8160.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: Casilinum coloniam deduxisti, ut vexillum tolleres, ut aratrum circumduceres (as usu. in founding a new city; v. aratrum), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida, quae prius erant circumducta aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl></cit> Müll.: bracchium (v. bracchium), Auct. B. Hisp. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Dubis, ut circino circumductum, paene totum oppidum cingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utro modo vero id circumductum est (of a round hole),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras subicere et circumducere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when a line is filled</tr>, <tr>to place the remaining letters of a word below the line</tr>, <tr>and draw circular marks around them</tr>, <tr>to indicate that they belong above</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 204</bibl> and 226: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra hominis lineis circumducta,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>represented by outlines</tr>, <tr>sketched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8160.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8160.4" n="A" level="2"> In conversat. language, aliquem aliqua re or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvenio, decipio, fraudo, fallo): aliquem argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigentis Philippis filius me et Chrusalus circumduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā me potes, circumduce, aufer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:33:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 33, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8160.5" n="B" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to use circumlocution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prolong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sensus unus longiore ambitu circumducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 124</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8160.6" n="C" level="2"> In prosody, <hi rend="ital">to speak drawlingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drawl out;</hi> only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO">12, 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:23" default="NO">1, 5, 23</bibl> Spald. and Zumpt.—</sense><sense id="n8160.7" n="D" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to draw lines around a law</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cancel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogate</hi> (cf. cancello, II., and circumscribo, II. D.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:73" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:27" default="NO">40, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:22" default="NO">49, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumductio: <entryFree id="n8161" type="main" key="circumducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumduco</etym>. <sense id="n8161.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conducting around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaerae,</quote> <trans><tr>the circumference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; of a person, Cod. Th. 4, 8, 1.—</sense><sense id="n8161.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n8161.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:Caterv. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. Caterv. 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8161.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The expansion of a thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a period</hi>, only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:118" default="NO">9, 4, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumductor: <entryFree id="n8162" type="main" key="circumductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leads about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converts</hi> another, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumductum: <entryFree id="n8163" type="hapax" key="circumductum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumductum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>circumduco, II. B.</etym>; <sense id="n8163.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in rhet.,</quote> <trans><tr>a period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumductus: <entryFree id="n8164" type="main" key="circumductus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumduco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8165" type="main" key="circumductus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumduco</etym>. <sense id="n8165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The circumference of a figure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n8165.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Motion in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumeo: <entryFree id="n8166" type="main" key="circu^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭm-ĕo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĕŏ</orth> (v. circum, III.; Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 736 sq.), īvi or ii, circuĭtum, īre (<sense id="n8166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> circumirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 81</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8166.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to go around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">march around</hi>, etc. (class.): <cb n="CIRC" /> sparsis Medea capillis Bacchantum ritu flagrantes circuit aras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hortum circuit,</quote> <trans><tr>makes a circuit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rectum limitem rupti torrentibus pontes inciderint, circumire cogemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: an quasi mare omnes circumimus insulas? i. e. <hi rend="ital">from one to another</hi> (cf. circum, II. C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec una opera circuit per familias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui imperavit ei, ut omnes fores aedificii circumiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcio et Atilio Epirus, Aetolia et Thessalia circumeundae assignantur... Lentuli circumeuntes Peloponnesi oppida, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 37, 3</bibl></cit> and 7: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ignarus erat circuitam ab Romanis eam (Hispaniam) legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Civilis avia Belgarum circumibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus nexis trunci modum,</quote> <trans><tr>to surround</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuere uno anno circumirier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximis insulis circuitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites circumitis hostium castris Crasso renuntiaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitis templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at pater omnipotens ingentia moenia caeli Circuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circueunt unum Phineus et mille secuti Phinea,</quote> <trans><tr>surround</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 157</bibl></cit> (cf. circum, II. E.): Leucada continuam veteres habuere coloni; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc freta circumeunt,</quote> <trans><tr>flow around it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more lupi oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metam ferventi rotā,</quote> <trans><tr>avoids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 396</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8166.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8166.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8166.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Esp. in milit. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">totam urbem muro turribusque circumiri posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem, sinistrum cornu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 93</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudine circumiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 26, 4</bibl>; Gall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab iisdem acies Pompeiana a sinistrā parte erat circumita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8166.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae circumibit linea, ejusdem spatii erit, cujus ea quae centum continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremas oleis pacalibus oras (Pallas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus non hederae circumiere caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 5, 26.—</sense><sense id="n8166.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go from one to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soliciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canvassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonishing</hi>, etc., qs. <hi rend="ital">to go the rounds</hi> (stronger than ambire, which signif. to go to this one and that; most freq. after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. perh. only once, in his epistt.): itaque prenso amicos, supplico, ambio domos stationesque circumeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Antonium) circumire veteranos, ut acta Caesaris sancirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinctilius circumire aciem Curionis atque obsecrare milites coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ipse Romulus circumibat docebatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 47, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 47, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Persarum tabernacula circumire, hortari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:69:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex agmen circuibat pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui orbem terrarum circumire non erit longum meā causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8166.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8166.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius belli fluctibus circumiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:18:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 18, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne superante numero et peritiā locorum circumiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8166.9" n="B" level="2"> Like our <hi rend="ital">circumvent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus indignum, Sic circumiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum arte dolosā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8166.10" n="C" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to express by circumlocution</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">res plurimae carent appellationibus, ut eas necesse sit transferre aut circumire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>, prooem. § 24 Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 2, 17: Vespasiani nomen suspensi et vitabundi circumibant,</quote> <trans><tr>went around</tr>, <tr>avoided mentioning it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumequito: <entryFree id="n8167" type="hapax" key="circu^me^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭm-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ride round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumerro: <entryFree id="n8168" type="main" key="circu^merro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭm-erro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroll about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque turba lateri circumerrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: tempora (of the revolution of Saturn in his orbit), <hi rend="ital">to pass through</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 71, 11.</sense></entryFree>
circumfarcio: <entryFree id="n8169" type="hapax" key="circumfarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-farcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n8169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>fartus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fill up all around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stuff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 21, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumferentia: <entryFree id="n8170" type="main" key="circumfe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumfĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumfero</etym>, <sense id="n8170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circumference</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sedilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 18, p. 359</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 817</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 33" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 33</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
circumfero: <entryFree id="n8171" type="main" key="circumfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype>, <sense id="n8171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. to bear round</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry</hi> <pb n="338" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> <hi rend="ital">round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8171.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">age circumfer mulsum,</quote> <trans><tr>pass around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatis vino ciboque poculum... circumferetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumferri vinum largius jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce (poculis) etiam nunc in publico convivio potio circumfertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=122" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 122</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem in pateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl> Duker: <cit><quote lang="la">circa ea omnia templa Philippum infestos circumtulisse ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyram in conviviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium suis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuque arma circumferens alia tela clipeo excipiebat, corpore alia vitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter heros Immanem circumfert tegmine silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta in expeditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubique pellem vituli marini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 90</bibl></cit>.—Of books carried about for sale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4 al" default="NO">2, 15, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc atque huc acies circumtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 558</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 674</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol ut circumferatur,</quote> <trans><tr>revolve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>; cf.: linea circumferens, <hi rend="ital">the circumference</hi>, Gromat. Vet. 5, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mirari hominem mercede conductum... ad nutum licentium circumferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8171.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly in the poets and histt.), <hi rend="ital">to spread around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:17" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17, 2</bibl>; 28, 3, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">belli umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et circumferentem arma Scipionem omnibus finitimis raptim perdomitis ipsam Carthaginem repente adgressurum credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1</bibl>, pr. 2; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 12, 1: signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia et caedes et terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem nominis sui late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar circumferens terrarum orbi praesentia pacis suae bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:92:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 92, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8171.3" n="B" level="2"> Of a narrative or discourse, <hi rend="ital">to publish abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divulge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disseminate among the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi> (prob. nct ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut circumferetur M. Philippi factum atque dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quidem ingens fama, haec nulla circumfert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi aliquam, quae se circumferat esse Corinnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 29</bibl></cit>. —Hence, of writings: <cit><quote lang="la">circumferri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be widely circulated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO">2, 15, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8171.4" n="C" level="2"> In the lang. of religion, <hi rend="ital">to lustrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify any one by carrying around him consecrated objects</hi> (torches, offerings, etc.) = lustrare, purgare: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso quin tu istanc jubes Pro cerritā circumferri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 144</bibl></cit>: aliquem pro larvato, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 229</bibl>: tum ferto omnia sum circumlatus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 27</bibl>: idem ter socios purā circumtulit undā, <hi rend="ital">carried around pure water</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for purification</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> constr. for undam circum socios), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 229</bibl> Serv. and Wagn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 74</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8171.5" n="D" level="2"> In rhetoric: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio deducta et circumlata,</quote> <trans><tr>expanded</tr>, <tr>drawn out into periods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
circumfigo: <entryFree id="n8172" type="main" key="circumfi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fīgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten round</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">columellam cuneis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo scelesti circumfiguntur Christo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfingo: <entryFree id="n8173" type="hapax" key="circumfingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfinio: <entryFree id="n8174" type="hapax" key="circumfi_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fīnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to complete a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to an end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfirmo: <entryFree id="n8175" type="hapax" key="circumfi_rmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fīrmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumflagro: <entryFree id="n8176" type="main" key="circumflagro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-flagro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blaze</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scorch all around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per immensum circumflagrantibus Austris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 274</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumflecto: <entryFree id="n8177" type="main" key="circumflecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-flecto</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi> (Verg. and post-class. writers); prop. of the charioteer in the circus; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.' longos cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8177.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumflexa saecula,</quote> <trans><tr>returning upon themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anceps labyrinthus et error circumflexus,</quote> <trans><tr>full of windings and turnings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8177.2" n="B" level="2"> In later gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to mark with a circumflex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce as long</hi> (in Quint., instead of it, circumducere, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">penultimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba circumflexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:7:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 425</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1287</bibl> ib. et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-flexē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with a circumflex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promere ( = pronuntiare) syllabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: enuntiare <cb n="CIRC" /> syllabam, Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Hor. S. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumflexe: <entryFree id="n8178" type="main" key="circumflexe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflexē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. circumflecto <sense id="n8178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumflexibilis: <entryFree id="n8179" type="main" key="circumflexi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflexĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumflecto</etym>, <sense id="n8179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with a circumflex accent</hi> (late Lat.), Excerpt. ex <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Diff. p. 235</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
circumflexio: <entryFree id="n8180" type="hapax" key="circumflexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi> or <hi rend="ital">winding round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliqua circuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumflexus: <entryFree id="n8181" type="main" key="circumflexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumflecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8182" type="main" key="circumflexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumflecto</etym>, <sense id="n8182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8182.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circuit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Tanais) per sinuosos labitur circumflexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumflo: <entryFree id="n8183" type="main" key="circumflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-flo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow round about;</hi> of the wind (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">in the class. per. only in the foll. exs.): circumflantibus Austris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8183.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ab omnibus ventis invidiae circumflari, <hi rend="ital">to be assailed by every blast. of envy</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfluo: <entryFree id="n8184" type="main" key="circumflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow round</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8184.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poculis repletis circumfluere quod supersit,</quote> <trans><tr>flows over all around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 68, § 163</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8184.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque latus circumfluit aequoris unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cariam circumfluunt Maeander et Orsinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 108</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliae aquae subterfluant terras, aliae circumfluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:30:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 30, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (oceanus) omnis terras circumfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Smyrna, quam circumfluit Meles fluvius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 686</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:5" default="NO">2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8184.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8184.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to flock around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulos circumfluxisse (lupum) et ungulis caedendo eum occidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluxit nos cervorum, aprorum, etc., multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">robora (dracones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 421</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8184.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be present</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exist in rich abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi>: circumfluentibus undique eloquentiae copiis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluentibus quietae felicitatis insignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundis rebus, quae circumfluunt vos, insanire coepistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8184.6" n="C" level="2"> Circumfluere aliquā re, like abundare, <hi rend="ital">to overflow with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have an abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be rich in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus copiis, atque in omnium rerum abundantiā vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluens gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina circumfluens Arretinorum exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluere atque abundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insatiabilis avaritiae est, adhuc inplere velle, quod jam circumfluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—Of too great copiousness of diction: <cit><quote lang="la">nec redundans, nec circumfluens oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>too copious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfluus: <entryFree id="n8185" type="main" key="circumflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumfluo</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose). <sense id="n8185.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumfluent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:739" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 66, 66, § 166</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8185.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowed around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded with water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus Hadriaco ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:220" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:442" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 442</bibl></cit>: campi Euphrate et Tigre, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis circumfluo ambitu Pontus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8185.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">surrounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys limbo Maeonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:540" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitrix gemmis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 138</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: mens luxu, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 40.</sense></entryFree>
circumfodio: <entryFree id="n8186" type="main" key="circumfo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fŏdĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n8186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, fossum, ĕre (<hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfodiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. fodio), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dig around something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig about</hi> (agricultural t. t.). </sense><sense id="n8186.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161</bibl>. 4.—</sense><sense id="n8186.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfodi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfosso stipite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 43, § 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumforaneus: <entryFree id="n8187" type="main" key="circumfo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forum</etym>. * <sense id="n8187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">around the forum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">market-place</hi>: aes, <hi rend="ital">debts due in the forum</hi> (because the bankers' shops were at the forum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Strolling about from market to market</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that attends markets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharmacopola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: lanista, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8187.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that is carried about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambulatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movable</hi>: <cb n="CIRC" /> domus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148, 29</bibl>: hostiae, <hi rend="ital">which are carried about for expiation</hi> (cf. circumfero, II. C.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumforatus: <entryFree id="n8188" type="hapax" key="circumfo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [foro], <sense id="n8188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierced round</hi>' stipes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 43, § 252</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfossor: <entryFree id="n8189" type="hapax" key="circumfossor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumfossor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumfodio</etym>, <sense id="n8189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who digs around something</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfossura: <entryFree id="n8190" type="hapax" key="circumfossu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumfossūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging round</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfractus: <entryFree id="n8191" type="main" key="circumfractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [frango], <sense id="n8191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broken off around</hi>: turbo, <hi rend="ital">broken around</hi> (sc. scopulos), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <trans><tr>precipitous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfremo: <entryFree id="n8192" type="main" key="circumfre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise around something</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nidos, of birds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 479</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfrico: <entryFree id="n8193" type="hapax" key="circumfri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-frĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scour</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfulcio: <entryFree id="n8194" type="hapax" key="circumfulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fulcĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold up around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfulgeo: <entryFree id="n8195" type="hapax" key="circumfulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 37, 37, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfundo: <entryFree id="n8196" type="main" key="circumfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit. <sense id="n8196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out around</hi>, i.e. as in circumdo, either with the <case>acc.</case> of that which is poured, <hi rend="ital">to pour around;</hi> or, with the <case>acc.</case> of that around which something is poured, <hi rend="ital">to surround with a liquid</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8196.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8196.2" n="A" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> of the liquid poured (with or without <case>dat.</case> of the object around which): <cit><quote lang="la">amurcam ad oleam circumfundito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris urbi circumfunditur,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounds</tr>, <tr>flows round the town</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 132</bibl></cit>.— More freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare circumfusum urbi,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea flowing around the town</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens circumfusis invia fluminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:582" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusus nobis spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec circumfuso pendebat in aëre tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>circumambient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:151" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 151</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Reflex.: circumfudit se repente nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—Once mid.: cum fervet (lac), ne circumfundatur, etc., <hi rend="ital">pour itself out around</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">run over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 126</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusa nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 586</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.3" n="B" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> of the object around which, etc., with or without <case>abl.</case> of the fluid: <cit><quote lang="la">(mortuum) cerā circumfuderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram crassissimus circumfundit aër,</quote> <trans><tr>encompasses</tr>, <tr>envelops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra circumfusa illo mari, quem oceanum appellatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et multo nebulae circum dea fudit amictu (tmesis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas circumfuderat atra tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:723" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 723</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to objects that do not flow, esp. if there is a great multitude, as it were, heaped upon a thing. </sense><sense id="n8196.5" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 1.) Mid., <hi rend="ital">to press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cling to</hi> (freq. in the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumfunduntur ex reliquis hostes partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3</bibl>. 63: <cit><quote lang="la">equites infestis cuspidibus circumfunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 19, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 23, 8: (Nymphae) circumfusae Dianam Corporibus texere suis,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo circumfusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 46, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 37</bibl>.—With the <case>dat.</case> of that upon which a multitude presses: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfundebantur obviis sciscitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">29, 34, 14 al.: circumfusa turba lateri meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: ut lateribus circumfundi posset equitatus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 9, 12</bibl>. —With <case>acc.</case> (depending on circum): Pacidiussuos equites exporrigere coepit... uthaberent facultatem turmas Julianas circumfundi, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass them</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 78 Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also of a single person: et nunc hac juveni, nunc circumfunditur illac, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clings to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">closely embraces him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 354</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (sc. Mavortem), tu, diva, tuo recubantem corpore sancto circumfusa super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.6" n="(b)" level="5"> So once in the active voice, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfudit eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique circumfusae molestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est tantum ab hostibus aetati nostrae periculum, quantum ab circumfusis undique voluptatibus, Liv 30, 14, 6: circumfuso nitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">environ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusus publicorum praesidiorum copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum castrorum circumfundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl>; Plin. <pb n="339" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> 5, 12, 13, § 67; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:306" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 306</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusus hostium concursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catonem vidi in bibliothecā sedentem, multis circumfusum Stoicorum libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 91</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexibus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">X. milia Bojorum alio latere quam exspectabatur missis legionibus circumfudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8196.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum has terras incolentes circumfusi erant caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latent ista omnia crassis occultata et circumfusa tenebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quantā luce ea circumfusa sunt, possint agnoscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos stultitiā obruit, tenebris circumfundit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfundit, aliquem multo splendore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumfusio: <entryFree id="n8197" type="main" key="circumfu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumfundo</etym>, <sense id="n8197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring around</hi> (post-class.)  spiritus ignei, Firm. Math. 1, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> praef.</sense></entryFree>
circumfusus: <entryFree id="n8198" type="main" key="circumfu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumfundo.</entryFree>
circumgarriens: <entryFree id="n8199" type="hapax" key="circumgarri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-garrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [garrio], <sense id="n8199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blabbing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">babbling about.</hi> falsiloquia, Claud Mam. <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> An. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumgelo: <entryFree id="n8200" type="main" key="circumge^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-gĕlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to freeze all around</hi> corpus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex circumgelatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 40, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumgemo: <entryFree id="n8201" type="hapax" key="circumge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roar around something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumgemit ursus ovile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:51" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumgesto: <entryFree id="n8202" type="main" key="circumgesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-gesto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry around</hi>' epistulam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">deam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, 213, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumglobatus: <entryFree id="n8203" type="hapax" key="circumglo^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-glŏbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [globo], <sense id="n8203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rolled together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conglobated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia escae circumglobata,</quote> <trans><tr>small insects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumgredior: <entryFree id="n8204" type="main" key="circumgre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, grĕdi</itype>, <sense id="n8204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v dep</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">walk around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel about</hi> (esp. in a hostile manner; post-Aug., several times in Tac, elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n8204.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8204.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: exercitum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 21</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl></cit>' Syriam, Aur Vict. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 21</bibl>' lacunam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumgressus: <entryFree id="n8205" type="main" key="circumgressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumgredior</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8206" type="main" key="circumgressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumgredior</etym> (perh. only in Amm.). * <sense id="n8206.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a going about</hi>' rapidi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 2, 3</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n8206.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circuit of a thing</hi>' amplissimi palus Maeotis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumhabitator: <entryFree id="n8207" type="gloss" key="circumha^bi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumhăbĭtātor</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">peri/oikos</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill p. 577, 4.</entryFree>
circumhisco: <entryFree id="n8208" type="hapax" key="circumhisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-hisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n8208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stare about with open mouth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5</bibl>, p 175 dub. (al. circumsciscere)</sense></entryFree>
circumhumatus: <entryFree id="n8209" type="main" key="circumhu^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-hŭmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part</hi> [humo], <hi rend="ital">buried around</hi>: corpora, Amm 22, 12, 8.</sense></entryFree>
circumicio: <entryFree id="n8210" type="main" key="circumi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ĭcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-jĭcĭo</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-jăcĭo</orth>, <itype>Liv 33</itype>, 18, 17, where more recent editt. read circumagere), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8210.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place around</hi> (in good class. prose)' amic tum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=132" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum, Liv 35, 4, 6: fossam quoque et alia munimenta verticibus iis... circumjecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:38:19:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars urbis, cui brevior orbis munitionis circumjectus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:36:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 36, 9, 12</bibl></cit> miles moenibus Cremonensium castra sua, castris vallum circumjecerat, Tac H. 3, 26 vehicula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:A. 14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl>' multitudinem hominum totis moenibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl> equites levisque armaturae quod erat cornibus circumjectum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 11</bibl> custodes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19 al.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (depending on circum): <cit><quote lang="la">quod anguis vectem circumjectus fuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had wound itself around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjec-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um, of localities</itype>, <hi rend="ital">lying around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounding</hi>' aedificia muris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae itineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus, Liv 31, 24, 17: silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit> oppida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 31: civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 43</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin..</hi> tecta, id A 15, 37.— <pos>Subst.</pos>' <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjecta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">the neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi circumjecta populabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse (cf. circumjaceo, II.): circumjectae orationis copia, <hi rend="ital">standing by</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8210.1" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">environ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>: extremitatem<cb n="CIRC" />  caeli rotundo ambitu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities saltibus circumjecta,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circuminicio: <entryFree id="n8211" type="hapax" key="circu^mi_ni^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭm-īnĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw up all around</hi>, = circumicio: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circuminvolvo: <entryFree id="n8212" type="hapax" key="circu^minvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭm-involvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to involve all around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula puncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit> (al. circumvolvo).</sense></entryFree>
circumitio: <entryFree id="n8213" type="main" key="circu^mi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭmĭtĭo</orth>, v. circuitio.</entryFree>
circumitus: <entryFree id="n8214" type="main" key="circu^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭmĭtus</orth>, v. circuitus.</entryFree>
