circumjaceo: <entryFree id="n8215" type="main" key="circumja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">border upon</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n8215.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, * Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi circumjacentes,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8215.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycaonia et Phrygia circumjacent Europae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiti et collo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 54, 33</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8215.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in rhet.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjăcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the context</hi>, Qumt. 9, 4, 29.</sense></entryFree>
circumjacio: <entryFree id="n8216" type="main" key="circumja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjăcĭo</orth>, v circumicio <sense id="n8216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumjectio: <entryFree id="n8217" type="main" key="circumjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumicio</etym>. <sense id="n8217.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casting about</hi> (postclass.) manuum, Cael. Aur Acut. 1, 2, 31. —* </sense><sense id="n8217.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting on clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dressing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, p 73</sense></entryFree>
circumjectus: <entryFree id="n8218" type="main" key="circumjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumicio</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8219" type="main" key="circumjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumicio</etym>, <sense id="n8219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a surrounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompassing</hi> (rare but class.): (aether) qui terram tenero circumjectu amplectitur, <hi rend="ital">with soft embrace</hi>, Cic. poet N. D. 2, 25, 65 (as transl. from Euripides <foreign lang="greek">*kai\ gh=n pe/ric e)/xonq) u(grai=s e)n a)gka/lais</foreign>)' arduus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl>' rudi parietum circumjectu vox devoratur, Plin 11, 51, 112, § 270.—</sense><sense id="n8219.1" n="II" level="1"> Meton (abstr pro concr), <hi rend="ital">that which is thrown around one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=132" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 132</bibl> Müll., p 37 Bip., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlabens: <entryFree id="n8220" type="main" key="circumla_bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lābens</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum lā-bens</orth>), <sense id="n8220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gliding around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 484</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlambo: <entryFree id="n8221" type="hapax" key="circumlambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick around</hi> ora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 171</bibl></sense></entryFree>
circumlaqueo: <entryFree id="n8222" type="hapax" key="circumla^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lăquĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wind around</hi>, in tmesis cassem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlaticius: <entryFree id="n8223" type="hapax" key="circumla_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlātĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumlatus</etym>, <sense id="n8223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be carried around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portable</hi> carcer, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
circumlatio: <entryFree id="n8224" type="main" key="circumla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n8224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a carrying around</hi> (post-class.): arcae, Tert adv Marc. 4, 12; victimae, Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlator: <entryFree id="n8225" type="main" key="circumla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries about</hi> (post-class.), Tert. adv Marc. 1, 19; 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumlatro: <entryFree id="n8226" type="main" key="circumla_^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lā^tro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8226.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to bark around</hi> hominem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 22:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 22, 3</bibl> leonem, Amm 22, 16, 16.—</sense><sense id="n8226.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of the sea (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totum hoc circumlatrat aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>roars around</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8226.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus circumlatratur injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:17" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 17</bibl></cit> aliquem frustra occultis injuriis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 12, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum circumlatrantes philosophi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 50</bibl></cit>: circumlatrantes haeretici, Aug Ep 136.</sense></entryFree>
circumlatus: <entryFree id="n8227" type="main" key="circumla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumfero</entryFree>
circumlavo: <entryFree id="n8228" type="main" key="circumla^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lăvo</orth>, <itype>āre and ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n8228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v a.</hi>, lit. <hi rend="ital">to wash around</hi>, hence, of waters, <hi rend="ital">to overflow all around</hi> (only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus, quam Nilus circumlavat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab 275" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab 275</bibl></cit>: insula superjactis fluctibus circumlavitur, Sall. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 504, 1</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl> Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>
circumlevo: <entryFree id="n8229" type="hapax" key="circumle^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lĕvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up all around</hi> tegmina, Cael Aur Acut. 2, 37, 194.</sense></entryFree>
circumligo: <entryFree id="n8230" type="main" key="circumli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8230.0" n="I" level="1"> Aliquid alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to bind something to something</hi>' natam mediae circumligat hastae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 555</bibl>' spongias hydropicis, Plin 31, 11, 47, § 128.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8230.1" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to bind something with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem salice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum stuppā, Liv 21, 8, 10: totas (radices) caespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 86</bibl></cit>' Roscius circumligatus angui, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 29</bibl>. —More generally: <cit><quote lang="la">globum undis,</quote> <trans><tr>to surround</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:347" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:675" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 675</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlino: <entryFree id="n8231" type="main" key="circumli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n8231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> late Lat. circumlinisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 23, 40</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlĭnĭo</orth>, īre; cf. lino; so, <cit><quote lang="la">circumliniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 8</bibl></cit> Spald. <cb n="CIRC" /> <hi rend="ital">N. er.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumliniri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumliniendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:9" default="NO">6, 17, 9</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n8231.1" n="I" level="1"> Aliquid alicui, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stick</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spread all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus aliquid circumlinitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbanum ramis ellebori circumlitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 13, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciroumlita taedis sulfura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 373</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n8231.2" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to besmear something all over with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedaub</hi> (class.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">oculum pice liquidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labellum luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 44, 1</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvos fimo bubulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 47, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:167" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 47, § 167</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: corpora fuco, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 744</bibl>: circumliti mortui cerā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictile argillā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 131 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictura, in quā nihil circumlitum est,</quote> <trans><tr>is painted around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8231.3" n="B" level="2"> -<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: extrinsecus adductis ea rebus circumliniunt, <hi rend="ital">they elevate them</hi>, as it were, <hi rend="ital">by strong coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 8</bibl>.—And (the figure derived from smearing musical instruments with wax, in order to produce a deep tone): simplicem vocis naturam pleniore quodam sono circumlinire, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">katapeplasme/non</foreign> dicunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi (mendacium) ornatu aliunde quaesito circumlitum fuerit ac politum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8231.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi>: circumlita saxa musco, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl>: (Midas) auro, Ov M. 11, 136.</sense></entryFree>
circumlitio: <entryFree id="n8232" type="main" key="circumli^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumlino</etym>. <sense id="n8232.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A smearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spreading over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 24, § 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8232.1" n="II" level="1"> In painting, <hi rend="ital">an overlaying of color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hue given to marble by rubbing it with a mixture of oil and wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 5</bibl>; v O. Müll. Archaeol. § 310, 4.</sense></entryFree>
circumlocutio: <entryFree id="n8233" type="main" key="circumlo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumlŏcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumloquor</etym>, <sense id="n8233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circumlocution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periphrasis</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/frasis</foreign>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumloquor: <entryFree id="n8234" type="main" key="circumlo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>lŏcūtus, lŏqui</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make use of circumlocution</hi> or <hi rend="ital">periphrasis</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 6, 7</bibl>, and 146, 15.</sense></entryFree>
circumlucens: <entryFree id="n8235" type="hapax" key="circumlu_cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lūcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [luceo], <sense id="n8235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glittering around;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumluo: <entryFree id="n8236" type="main" key="circumlu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow around</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wash upon</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus tergum ac latera circumluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars arcis circumluitur mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora subit et circumluit pelagus, Mel. prooem. 2: (Aegeum) mare laevā Imbrum et Tenedum circumluens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumlustro: <entryFree id="n8237" type="main" key="circumlustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lustro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light all around;</hi> in tmesis: mundi templum, Lucr 5, 1437.—</sense><sense id="n8237.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to travel over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi>: populos provinciae, Cod. Th. 4, 8, 5.</sense></entryFree>
circumluvio: <entryFree id="n8238" type="main" key="circumlu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-lŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-cumlŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, <sense id="n8238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the accumulation of land by alluvion around a piece of land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alluvial land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura circumluvionum,</quote> <trans><tr>the right of using such land</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>.—Form circumluvium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 14</bibl> Müll., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 8, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circummeo: <entryFree id="n8239" type="main" key="circumme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum eam (sc. Taprobanen) isse, for circummeasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circummetior: <entryFree id="n8240" type="hapax" key="circumme_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <sense id="n8240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be measured around.</hi> columnae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circummingo: <entryFree id="n8241" type="main" key="circummingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water around something;</hi> aliquem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 62, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circummitto: <entryFree id="n8242" type="main" key="circummitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationes in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 55</bibl>: praecones, id B. G. 5, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugo circummissus Veiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaphas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 25, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circummoenio: <entryFree id="n8243" type="main" key="circummoeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circummoenĭo</orth>, v circummunio.</entryFree>
circummulcens: <entryFree id="n8244" type="hapax" key="circummulcens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mulcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [mulceo], <sense id="n8244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">licking gently around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae (serpentium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circummunio: <entryFree id="n8245" type="main" key="circummu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mūnĭo</orth> (old orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-cummoenĭo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 4</bibl>), <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wall up around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> (freq. in the histt., elsewhere rare; but in MSS. constantly confounded with circumvenire; cf. Oud. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 84</bibl>; 2, 16; 3, 97; Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Col. 5, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">plantas caveis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <pb n="340" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> oppidum, Auct. B. Afr. 79: <cit><quote lang="la">Thapsum operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Hisp. 38: aliquos ut feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes) vallo fossāque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris castellis circummuniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Auct. B. Hisp. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circummunitio: <entryFree id="n8246" type="main" key="circummu_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circummūnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circummunio</etym>; <sense id="n8246.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in milit. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>an investing of a town</tr>, <tr>circumvallation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circummuranus: <entryFree id="n8247" type="main" key="circummu_ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-mūrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n8247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">around</hi> (but beyond) <hi rend="ital">the walls</hi> (perh. only in Amm.): <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <trans><tr>with the neighboring nations</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumnascens: <entryFree id="n8248" type="hapax" key="circumnascens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-nascens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [nascor], <sense id="n8248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing up around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 232</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumnavigo: <entryFree id="n8249" type="hapax" key="circumna_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumnavigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus Oceani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumnecto: <entryFree id="n8250" type="main" key="circumnecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-necto</orth>, no <sense id="n8250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>nexum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to wrap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti flammis conjectis undique circumnexi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: tenuis membrana illa perlucens, quā circumnectitur alvus, ac tegitur, Lact. Opif. Dei, 14, 2 (al. circumretitur).</sense></entryFree>
circumnoto: <entryFree id="n8251" type="main" key="circumno^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to paint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portray around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia vario colore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 279, 12, p. 273</bibl></cit> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
circumobruo: <entryFree id="n8252" type="main" key="circumobru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ob-rŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover around with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumornatus: <entryFree id="n8253" type="main" key="circumorna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented round about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:143:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 143, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpadanus: <entryFree id="n8254" type="main" key="circumpa^da_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pădānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">found</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situate around the Po</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpavitus: <entryFree id="n8255" type="hapax" key="circumpa^vi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-păvītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pavio], <sense id="n8255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beaten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trodden close around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpendeo: <entryFree id="n8256" type="main" key="circumpendeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pendeo</orth> (better written as two words), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritis circum pendentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:529" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 529</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpes: <entryFree id="n8257" type="main" key="circumpe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype> (that is round the feet). <sense id="n8257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of parasites</hi> (cf. antepes), Agroet. Orth. p. 2274 P.—</sense><sense id="n8257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A covering of the foot</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">periskeli/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 45, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumplaudo: <entryFree id="n8258" type="hapax" key="circumplaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-plaudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to applaud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">greet on all sides by clapping the hands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumplecto: <entryFree id="n8259" type="main" key="circumplecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumplecto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n8259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of circumplector; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 312), <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum collum circumplecte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumplectito foramina laminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi> circumplexus: <cit><quote lang="la">turris igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 171 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
circumplector: <entryFree id="n8260" type="main" key="circumplector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-plector</orth>, <itype>plexus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clasp around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones motu undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini patrimonium quasi thesaurum draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 22, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:65" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 10, 19, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collem opere,</quote> <trans><tr>to circumvallate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>: oppidum tragulis, Auct. B. Hisp. 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam pennis, of the eagle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8260.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum, imago quaedam... circumplectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumplexus: <entryFree id="n8261" type="main" key="circumplexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumplexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. circumplecto <sense id="n8261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8262" type="main" key="circumplexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumplexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumplector</etym>, <sense id="n8262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an encompassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">folding around;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 63, 83, § 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumplico: <entryFree id="n8263" type="main" key="circumpli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8263.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twine around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum esset ostentum, si anguem vectis circumplicavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum surculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:14:section=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 14, § 9</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">belua circumplicata serpentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer serpentis amplexu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8263.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bend around</hi>, Lact. Opif. Dei, 12, 5.</sense></entryFree>
circumplumbo: <entryFree id="n8264" type="hapax" key="circumplumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-plumbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour in lead around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modiolos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpono: <entryFree id="n8265" type="main" key="circumpo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsui, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place around</hi> (perh. not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="CIRC" /> stramenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 263</bibl>: armatos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>: piper catillis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus stagno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpositio: <entryFree id="n8266" type="main" key="circumpo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumpono</etym>, <sense id="n8266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placing around</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpotatio: <entryFree id="n8267" type="gloss" key="circumpo_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumpōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n8267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking around in a funeral meal</hi>, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumpulso: <entryFree id="n8268" type="hapax" key="circumpulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pulso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat around;</hi> of sounds: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to din</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:228" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumpungo: <entryFree id="n8269" type="main" key="circumpungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puncture around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum pedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi circum scarificati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 101</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
circumpurgo: <entryFree id="n8270" type="main" key="circumpurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-purgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purify around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanct. 1, 10, 113 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
circumputo: <entryFree id="n8271" type="main" key="circumpu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure all round</hi>: computato Oceano, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 114.</sense></entryFree>
circumquaque: <entryFree id="n8272" type="hapax" key="circumqua_que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-quāque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n8272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on every side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all round</hi>, Auct. Orig. Gent. Rom. 17, 6.</sense></entryFree>
circumrado: <entryFree id="n8273" type="main" key="circumra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-rādo</orth>, <itype>rāsi, rāsum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scrape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shave</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pare around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsillas digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>, n. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum circumrasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumrasio: <entryFree id="n8274" type="hapax" key="circumra_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumrāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumrado</etym>, <sense id="n8274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paring around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39</bibl></cit>. § 246.</sense></entryFree>
circumretio: <entryFree id="n8275" type="main" key="circumre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-rētĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enclose with a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insnare.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8275.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Martem et Venerem Vulcani esse circumretitos arte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 186</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, p. 181</bibl>; cf. circumnecto <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n8275.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fraude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: cum te implicatum severitate judicum, circumretitum frequentiă populi Romani esse videam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumrodo: <entryFree id="n8276" type="main" key="circumro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-rōdo</orth>, <itype>di, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnaw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nibble all round.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8276.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">escam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8276.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: dudum enim circumrodo, quod devorandum est, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have long hesitated to speak out</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>: qui Dente Theonino cum circumroditur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is slandered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calumniated</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumrorans: <entryFree id="n8277" type="hapax" key="circumro_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-rōrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [roro], <sense id="n8277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sprinkling all round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumroto: <entryFree id="n8278" type="main" key="circumro^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-rŏto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn round in a circle</hi>: caeli orbem, C. <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Fragm. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsaepio: <entryFree id="n8279" type="main" key="circumsaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-saepĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sēp-</orth>), <itype>sepsi, septum, īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hedge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fence round with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumsepta loca parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 3, § 14</bibl>: stagnum aedificiis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solium circumsaeptum lapide Thrasio,</quote> <trans><tr>on a platform of Thrasian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tarquinius) armatis corpus circumsepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of a hostile surrounding: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quādam turre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">īsdem ignibus circumsaepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsaltans: <entryFree id="n8280" type="hapax" key="circumsaltans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-saltans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [salto], <sense id="n8280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dancing around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscalptus: <entryFree id="n8281" type="hapax" key="circumscalptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scalptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [scalpo], <sense id="n8281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraped around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscariphicatus: <entryFree id="n8282" type="main" key="circumsca^ri^phi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scărĭphĭcātus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scărĭphātus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 21</bibl>), a, um, <mood>Part.</mood> [scarifico], <sense id="n8282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scarified around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscindo: <entryFree id="n8283" type="hapax" key="circumscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scindo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tear off around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem et spoliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscribo: <entryFree id="n8284" type="main" key="circumscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8284.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to draw a line around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to circumscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose in a circle</hi> (in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. in Cic.): orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineas extremas umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulā stantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgā regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneā fibulā pars auriculae latissima circumscribitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram surculo heliotropii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8284.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw a line as the circumference</hi> of a thing (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl>), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to define</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lim it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumscribe</hi> (syn.: definio, <cb n="CIRC" /> describo, termino): <cit><quote lang="la">nullis ut terminis (orator) circumscribat aut definiat jus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus universum brevi circumscribi et definiri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum nobis vitae curriculum natura circumscripsit, immensum gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus regionibus vitae spatium circumscriptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante enim circumscribitur mente sententia confestimque verba concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum habitandi alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus undique circumscribit omnes terras et ambit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti mihi dicas et quasi circumscribas verbis, quid homo sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.3" n="B" level="2"> To bring within narrow bounds, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hem in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder free action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, etc. (syn.: claudo, includo, coërceo). </sense><sense id="n8284.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Esp., of the restrictions or hinderances imposed by one magistracy or authority upon another: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatus credo praetorem eum circumscripsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 88</bibl></cit> (cf. just before: <cit><quote lang="la">an consules in praetore coërcendo fortes fuissent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille se fluvio Rubicone et CC. milibus circumscriptum esse patiatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulam et ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscribere corpus et animo locum laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 19:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">uno genere genus hoc aratorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to comprehend in one class</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 149</bibl></cit> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">totum Dionysium sex epitomis circumscripsit,</quote> <trans><tr>abridged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut luxuriam vilitate circumscribamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.6" n="2" level="3"> In later medic. lang. circumscribi = minui, <hi rend="ital">to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravedo circumscribitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8284.7" n="C" level="2"> To encircle or go around by writing = scribendo circumdare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumvent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insnare</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvenio, decipio): fallacibus et captiosis interrogationibus circumscripti atque decepti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3, 14, § 48</bibl>: non circumscribetur, qui ita se gesserit, ut dicat, etc., <hi rend="ital">will not be deceived</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will commit no error</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 82, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.8" n="2" level="3"> In mercantile lang., <hi rend="ital">to deprive of money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overreach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:222" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:237" default="NO">14, 237</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Roscio HS. IↃↃↃ. circumscriptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <trans><tr>to embezzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 340" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 340</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.9" n="3" level="3"> In law, <hi rend="ital">to defeat the purpose of a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a will</hi>, etc., by a forced or too literal interpretation: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita circumscripto testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 112" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 112</bibl>: constitutiones, Lact. de Ira Dei, 8.—</sense><sense id="n8284.10" n="4" level="3"> Of circumlocution, <hi rend="ital">to involve</hi> in language: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio rem simplicem circumscribens elocutione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facetis jocis sacrilegium circumscribens,</quote> <trans><tr>covering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cancel; to declare invalid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invalidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set aside</hi> (cf. circumduco, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc omni tempore Sullano ex accusatione circumscripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:16:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 16, § 43</bibl></cit> (sublato, circumducto, praetermisso, Ascon.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumscriptis igitur iis seutentiis, quas posui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n8284.12" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A.) In rhet., <hi rend="ital">rounded into periods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periodic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscripti verborum ambitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl>, and v. circumscriptio.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scriptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in periods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscripte numeroseque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:221" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66, 221</bibl></cit>: circumscripte complecti singulas res. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 147</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8284.13" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Restricted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis et circumscripta quaedam explicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vis orationis) pressior et circumscriptior et adductior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-scriptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscripte et breviter ostendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 20</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos>, and <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of the <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
circumscripte: <entryFree id="n8285" type="main" key="circumscripte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>circumscri, bo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1. and 2.</entryFree>
circumscriptio: <entryFree id="n8286" type="main" key="circumscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumscribo</etym>. * <sense id="n8286.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (acc. to circumscribo, I.), <hi rend="ital">an encircling</hi>, and (concrete) <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex circumscriptione excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8286.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to circumscribo, II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A boundary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compass</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): terrae situm, <pb n="341" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> formam, circumscriptionem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitas, quam nulla temporis circumscriptio metiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporeae forma circumscriptionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8286.2" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n8286.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa enim natura verborum quādam circumscriptione comprehendit concluditque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8286.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A compendious statement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summing up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8286.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A figure of speech</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the limitation of a question by the removal of a circumstance in dispute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl> Halm (dub.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n8286.6" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to circumscribo, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">A deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overreaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauding</hi> (esp. in pecuniary transactions, and by judicial artifice, by pettifogging): <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediorum proscriptiones cum mulierculis apertā circumscriptione fecisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 30, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 9, 4</bibl>.—In gen., of <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscriptor: <entryFree id="n8287" type="main" key="circumscriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumscribo</etym>. * <sense id="n8287.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to circumscribo, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">A defrauder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Contr. 6, 3</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 10, 27, § 4.—* </sense><sense id="n8287.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to circumscribo, II. D.) <hi rend="ital">He who makes void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annuls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumscriptorie: <entryFree id="n8288" type="main" key="circumscripto_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n8288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by fraud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>: agere aliquid, Lex Rom. Burg. tit. 36.</sense></entryFree>
circumscriptus: <entryFree id="n8289" type="main" key="circumscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from circumscribo, q. v. <sense id="n8289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumseco: <entryFree id="n8290" type="main" key="circumse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĕco</orth>, no <sense id="n8290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sectum <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pare around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuberculum ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: aliquid serrulā, <hi rend="ital">to saw around</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsecta aluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 229" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 229</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8290.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To circumcise</hi>, of the Jews (usu. circumcido), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsecus: <entryFree id="n8291" type="main" key="circumse^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n8291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the region around</hi> (only in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">astantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 166, 23; 11, p. 264, 33; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 74.</sense></entryFree>
circumsedeo: <entryFree id="n8292" type="main" key="circumse^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĕdĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĭdĕo</orth>), <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit around a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8292.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter tot milia populi circumsedentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes amicorum turba circumsedet: circa eversos ingens solitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.— Esp., </sense><sense id="n8292.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To encamp around in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to besiege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beset</hi> (in Cic. and Liv. several times; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): qui Mutinam circumsedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9, 3</bibl>; 15, 9, 2; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 1</bibl>; 25, 22, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 65, 12: vallo et armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiam militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus populi Romani circumsessus, non modo igni, ferro, manu, copiis oppugnatus, sed aliquā ex parte violatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsessus es. A quibus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">81: populus, qui te circumsedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>, § 83; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem circumsessis ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra circumsessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 42, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8292.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sum ille ferreus, qui... non movear horum omnium lacrimis, a quibus me circumsessum videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">circumsessum muliebribus blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsederi urbem Romanam ab invidiā et odio finitimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumseparo: <entryFree id="n8293" type="hapax" key="circumse_pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sēpăro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to separate around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gingivas a dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:74" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsepio: <entryFree id="n8294" type="main" key="circumse_pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sēpĭo</orth>, v. circumsaepio.</entryFree>
circumsero: <entryFree id="n8295" type="hapax" key="circumse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">plant around something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genistas alveariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 42, § 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsessio: <entryFree id="n8296" type="hapax" key="circumsessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumsessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumsedeo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n8296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoslile encompassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a besieging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsessus: <entryFree id="n8297" type="main" key="circumsessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumsessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumsedeo.</entryFree>
circumsideo: <entryFree id="n8298" type="main" key="circumsi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumsĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. circumsedeo.</entryFree>
circumsido: <entryFree id="n8299" type="main" key="circumsi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self around</hi> in a hostile manner, <hi rend="ital">to besiege</hi> (several times in Livy; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): Plistiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 19, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 56, 5: regem urbemque Philippopolim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CIRC" /></sense></entryFree>
circumsigno: <entryFree id="n8300" type="main" key="circumsigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-signo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsilio: <entryFree id="n8301" type="main" key="circumsi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <sense id="n8301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leap</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hop around</hi> (rare): (passer) circumsiliens modo huc, modo illuc, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leap about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>: morborum omne genus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 218</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsisto: <entryFree id="n8302" type="main" key="circumsisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĕti</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl> Oud. <sense id="n8302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 4, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:15:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 15, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl>; cf. circumsto; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely circumstiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to place one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s stand around a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand around</hi> (class.; most freq. in the histt.; in Cic. perh. only once). </sense><sense id="n8302.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me circumsistitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 51, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsumque domumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:490 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 490 al.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
