G. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ab omnibus civitatibus circumsisteretur (Caesar),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8302.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsistamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum maxime loqueretur, sex lictores circumsistunt (sc. loquentem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstiterant victores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsistentia tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:42" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. also circumsto.</sense></entryFree>
circumsitus: <entryFree id="n8303" type="hapax" key="circumsi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sino</etym>, <sense id="n8303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situate around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 17, p. 358</bibl></cit> Bip. al.</sense></entryFree>
circumsocius: <entryFree id="n8304" type="main" key="circumso^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sŏcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neighborly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in friendly neighborhood</hi>: nationes, Sext. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsono: <entryFree id="n8305" type="main" key="circumso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sŏno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n8305.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with something</hi>) <hi rend="ital">on every side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be filled with any sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, qui circumsonat ululatibus cantuque symphoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 18, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 582</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8305.2" n="B" level="2"> Of the sound itself, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux theatri sui audiens plausum, in modum planctus, circumsonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8305.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8305.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surround a thing with a sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make something to echo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill everywhere with a sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures vocibus undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 4</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 7</bibl>, personare aurem): <cit><quote lang="la">clamor hostes circumsonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rutulus murum circumsonat armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 474</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā totum Nereus circumsonat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 187</bibl></cit> Haupt (al. circumsonat): <cit><quote lang="la">me luxuria undique circumsonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8305.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threicio Scythioque fere circumsonor ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:13:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 13, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc procul a patriā Geticis circumsonor armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsonus: <entryFree id="n8306" type="main" key="circumso^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding all around.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n8306.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filling with sounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba canum,</quote> <trans><tr>barking around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 723</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8306.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled with sounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resounding around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thisbe avibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:261" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspectatrix: <entryFree id="n8307" type="main" key="circumspecta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-spectātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spectator</etym>, <sense id="n8307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who looks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spies around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 76, p. 323, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspecte: <entryFree id="n8308" type="main" key="circumspecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. circumspicio, <sense id="n8308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circumspectio: <entryFree id="n8309" type="main" key="circumspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumspicio</etym>. * <sense id="n8309.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a looking on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a looking about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum, sibi horizontem facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8309.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caution</hi> (v. circumspicio, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectio et accurata consideratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Fragm. Val. § 35: prudentiae insunt ratio, intellectus, circumspectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspecto: <entryFree id="n8310" type="main" key="circumspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-specto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look about with attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to cast a look around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to search around;</hi> and with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to look about one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> (<hi rend="ital">attentively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">after something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look all around upon something</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n8310.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8310.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum circumspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit> (al.: <cit><quote lang="la">me circumspecto): quanto se opere custodiant bestiae, ut in pastu circumspectent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum circumspectans tergiversari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectans huc et illuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8310.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: te hercle ego <cb n="CIRC" /> circumspectabam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque me circumspectabitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>to look about anxiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 41, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare et silvas, ignota omnia circumspectantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 32</bibl></cit> Ritter (Halm: circum spectantes).—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta atque inanima, tectum et parietes circumspectabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8310.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nabis quanam ipse evaderet circumspectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. with foll. <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 36, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quam reperiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8310.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum alius alium, ut proelium ineant, circumspectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Reflex. (only in Plaut.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicio, I. A.): loca contemplat, circumspectat sese, atque aedis noscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 45</bibl> supra.—</sense><sense id="n8310.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitans, circumspectans, haesitans, tanquam rate in mari immenso nostra vehitur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectantes defectionis tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>watching</tr>, <tr>waiting</tr>, <tr>on the look-out for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium erumpendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasianus bellum armaque et procul vel juxta sitas vires circumspectabat,</quote> <trans><tr>carefully weighed</tr>, <tr>considered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fugam et fallendi artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina quasso imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes argumentorum locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspector: <entryFree id="n8311" type="main" key="circumspector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumspicio</etym>, <sense id="n8311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">septem circumspectores sedentes in excelso ad speculandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 37, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>all-seeing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspectus: <entryFree id="n8312" type="main" key="circumspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>circumspicio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8313" type="main" key="circumspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumspicio</etym>. <sense id="n8313.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a looking around eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously; a spying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searching around</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cervix flexilis ad circumspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) circumspectum omnium nobis dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 5</bibl></cit> (32), 4.—</sense><sense id="n8313.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malique In circumspectu stat sine fine sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut distineret regem ab circumspectu rerum aliarum,</quote> <trans><tr>consideration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8313.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a view around</hi>: facilis est circumspectus, unde exeam, quo progrediar, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo se progressos, unde in omnes partes circumspectus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspergo: <entryFree id="n8314" type="main" key="circumspergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-spergo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-spargo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8:section=406" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 8, § 406</bibl>; cf. aspergo), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strew</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">scatter something around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternos modios stercoris caprini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:87" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: impensam talem, Apic. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n8314.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sprinkle with something all around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se purificantes aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspicientia: <entryFree id="n8315" type="hapax" key="circumspi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumspicio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n8315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumspicio: <entryFree id="n8316" type="main" key="circumspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>exi, ectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n8316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. circumspexti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 55</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> sync. circumspexe, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 106, 16</bibl>, or Sat. Men. 82), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n8316.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look about one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast a look around;</hi> or, with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicedum, numquis est, Sermonem nostrum quiaucupet,</quote> <trans><tr>see whether there is any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. l. l.: suus conjux ubi sit circumspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicere late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quid circumspexti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi circumspiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in auspicium adhibetur nec suspicit nec circumspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicit, aestuat, of one in trouble or perplexity,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Sometimes circumspicere se, <hi rend="ital">to look about one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicedum te, ne quis adsit arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 109</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 106, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 47: numquamne te circumspicies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—In partic., <hi rend="ital">to look about one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self with haughtiness; to think highly of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eone te diligis et magnifice circumspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop. of language: Romanus sermo magis se circumspicit et aestimat praebetque aestimandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8316.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exercise foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take heed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse circumspiciendum diligenter, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: cui mandetis (rempublicam) circumspicite <pb n="342" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 10</bibl> Dietsch.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n8316.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to view on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to survey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sua quisque miles circumspiceret,</quote> <trans><tr>looked carefully to see</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam latā acie ne ex medio quidem cornua sua circumspicere poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <trans><tr>to review</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 318</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">habitum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. under <itype>circumspectus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n8316.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To descry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get sight of by looking around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum circumspicit ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:896" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 896</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">in latus omne patens turris circumspicit undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8316.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To view something mentally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to survey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">considero, perpendo): reliqua ejus consilia animo circumspiciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicite paulisper mentibus vestris hosce ipsos homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque temere consulem saltatorem vocare, sed circumspicere, quibus praeterea vitiis adfectum esse necesse sit eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">rel. -clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectis rebus omnibus rationibusque subductis summam feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta sunt in causis circumspicienda, ne quid offendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 301</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspicite celeriter animo, qui sint rerum exitus consecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quaere, circumspice, si quis est forte ex eā provinciā qui te nolit perisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:77:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 77, § 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 63</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:87" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum circumspicerent Patres quosnam consules facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look about for something with desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek for</hi>, etc. (so mostly since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec, sicut aestivas aves, statim auctumno tecta ac recessum circumspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">externa auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 30, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:26" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas belli causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinos reges sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 40, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:4" default="NO">22, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viresque suas circumspectantes his validiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n8316.10" n="A" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">weighed with care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well considered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspect</hi> (perh. not ante - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba non circumspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:539" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectissima sanctio decreti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person who carefully weighs a thing, <hi rend="ital">circumspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo circumspectus et sagax, modo inconsultus et praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectissimus et prudentissimus princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues et circumspecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:12" default="NO">1, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliquis circumspectior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of dogs: <cit><quote lang="la">assidui et circumspecti magis quam temeraril,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8316.12" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">worthy of consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectum et verecundum nomen populi Romani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectus genere, famā potentiāque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumspectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with mature deliberation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspectly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspecte compositeque indutus et amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumspecte vestiti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspecte facti versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 7, § 8</bibl></cit>: parcius et circumspectius faciendum est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectius donare, eligere eos, in quos merita conferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstagno: <entryFree id="n8317" type="hapax" key="circumstagno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-stagno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be poured forth all around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstantia: <entryFree id="n8318" type="main" key="circumstanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumstantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumsto</etym> (post-Aug. and rare). <sense id="n8318.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A standing round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a surrounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae, aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit> (as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ntiperi/stasis</foreign>).—* </sense><sense id="n8318.1" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a surrounding circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angelorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8318.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum negotiorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:2" default="NO">14, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 17</bibl>: hoc genus argumentorum<cb n="CIRC" />  sane dicamus ex circumstantiā, quia <foreign lang="greek">peri/stasin</foreign> dicere aliter non possumus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstatio: <entryFree id="n8319" type="hapax" key="circumsta^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumstătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumsto</etym>, <sense id="n8319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing around;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstipo: <entryFree id="n8320" type="main" key="circumsti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-stīpo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum stīpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry and rare).— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā circumstipante catervā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 453</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 356</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 595</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsto: <entryFree id="n8321" type="main" key="circumsto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sto</orth>, <itype>stĕti, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> having the same form with those of circumsisto, and a similar meaning, it is sometimes doubtful to which verb a form belongs), <hi rend="ital">to stand around in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take a station round;</hi> and, with the <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to stand around a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8321.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n8321.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: circumstant cum ardentibus taedis, Enn ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. v. 51 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumstant lacrimis rorantes ora genasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Morini spe praedae adducti circumsteterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstant properi aurigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad circumstantes tendens sua bracchia silvas, Ov M. 3, 441: circumstantis exercitūs gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8321.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romani qui circumstant senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:717" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8321.4" n="2" level="3"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumstantes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the by-standers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:127" default="NO">4, 2, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8321.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to surround in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstare tribunal praetoris urbani, obsidere cum gladiis curiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tres Curiatii circumsteterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ambo consules infesti circumstarent tribunum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 585</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n8321.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi> (freq. in post-Aug prose); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dies et noctes omnia nos undique fata circumstent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstant te summae auctoritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanti undique terrores circumstarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anceps proelium Romanos circumsteterat, incertos in quem hostem eruptionem facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancepsque terror circumstabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec me cura, haec difficultas sola circumstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at me tum primum saevus circumstetit horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio acerba meorum Circumstare odia ( = meos, qui me oderunt),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 905</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsteterat Civilem et alius metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsteterat palatium publica exspectatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas et angustiae rerum nascentes eos circumsteterunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circumstantĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">details</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi>, in an argument: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (argumenta) per se fortia non oportet circumstantibus obscurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstrepo: <entryFree id="n8322" type="main" key="circumstre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-strĕpo</orth>, no <sense id="n8322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>pĭtum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n8322.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a noise around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to din with clamor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to echo around</hi> (post-Aug.), (legatus) clamore seditiosorum circumstrepitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae canticis circumstrepitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 75, p. 322, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8322.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tothumanam vitam circumstrepentibus minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8322.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shout clamorously around</hi> (so only twice in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam atrociora circumstrepebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri circumstrepunt, iret in castra, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstridens: <entryFree id="n8323" type="hapax" key="circumstri_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-strīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [strido], <sense id="n8323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shrieking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gibbering around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">larvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstringo: <entryFree id="n8324" type="main" key="circumstringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-stringo</orth>, no <sense id="n8324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>strictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post-class.). * </sense><sense id="n8324.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui rei: habitus cervicibus circumstrictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8324.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tie around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aliquā re: pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstruo: <entryFree id="n8325" type="main" key="circumstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-strŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n8325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to build round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround with buildings</hi> (post-Aug. and mostly in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n8325.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Aliquid aliquā re: lacrimis arborum fores<cb n="CIRC" />  alveorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripis undique circumstructis lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 48, § 163</bibl></cit>. aënum lateribus circumstructum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:38:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 38, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8325.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Aliquid circumstructo juxta Tiberim lacu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:11" default="NO">9, 15, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumstupeo: <entryFree id="n8326" type="hapax" key="circumstu^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-stŭpĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look around with amazement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand amazed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 336</bibl> dub. (al. circumstrepit).</sense></entryFree>
circumsudans: <entryFree id="n8327" type="hapax" key="circumsu_dans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sūdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sudo], <sense id="n8327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweating on all sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsurgens: <entryFree id="n8328" type="main" key="circumsurgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-surgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [surgo], <sense id="n8328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rising all around</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumsutus: <entryFree id="n8329" type="main" key="circumsu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-sūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [suo], <sense id="n8329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sewed together all around</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">linamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia corio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:156" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 16, 47, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtego: <entryFree id="n8330" type="main" key="circumte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover round about</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus veste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca testamenti circumtecta ex omni parte auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also the spurious line,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1094</bibl></cit> Lachm. and Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
circumteneo: <entryFree id="n8331" type="hapax" key="circumte^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tĕnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n8331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to possess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esdr. 16, 40.</sense></entryFree>
circumtentus: <entryFree id="n8332" type="main" key="circumtentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tendo], <sense id="n8332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered with something that is stretched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawn around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begirt</hi> (anteand post-class.): elephanti corio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum linteolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:174" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtergeo: <entryFree id="n8333" type="hapax" key="circumtergeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tergeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wipe around</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtermino: <entryFree id="n8334" type="hapax" key="circumtermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-termĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limit round about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 8, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtero: <entryFree id="n8335" type="hapax" key="circumte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub around</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for, <hi rend="ital">to stand close around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:95" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtextus: <entryFree id="n8336" type="main" key="circumtextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-textus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [texo], <sense id="n8336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woven all around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 649</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-textum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garment inwoven with purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quod amictui habet purpuram circum, vocant circumtextum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=132" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtinnio: <entryFree id="n8337" type="hapax" key="circumtinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tinkle around</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtollo: <entryFree id="n8338" type="hapax" key="circumtollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove on every side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:42" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtondeo: <entryFree id="n8339" type="main" key="circumtondeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tondeo</orth>, v. circumtonsus.</entryFree>
circumtono: <entryFree id="n8340" type="main" key="circumto^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tŏno</orth>, <itype>ui, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder around;</hi> or, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamor around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:254" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulam strepitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem undā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8340.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc circumtonuit gaudens Bellona cruentis (the figure taken from the clanging of the war-trumpets),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtonsus: <entryFree id="n8341" type="main" key="circumtonsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tondeo], <sense id="n8341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shorn all around</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n8341.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 179, 8</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio circumtonsa et fucata et manu facta,</quote> <trans><tr>elaborate</tr>, <tr>artificial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtorqueo: <entryFree id="n8342" type="hapax" key="circumtorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me retrorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtraho: <entryFree id="n8343" type="main" key="circumtra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drag around</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtremo: <entryFree id="n8344" type="main" key="circumtre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumtrĕmo</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1089" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1089</bibl>), more correctly written apart, <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum trĕmo</orth>.</entryFree>
circumtueor: <entryFree id="n8345" type="hapax" key="circumtueo^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tuĕŏr</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <sense id="n8345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look around</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumtumulatus: <entryFree id="n8346" type="main" key="circumtu^mu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-tŭmŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piled up around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumundique: <entryFree id="n8347" type="main" key="circumundi^que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-undĭque</orth>, v. circum, I. A. b.</entryFree>
circumustus: <entryFree id="n8348" type="main" key="circumustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-ustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n8348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burnt around</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=5:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 5, 3</bibl>, Müll.</sense></entryFree>
circumvado: <entryFree id="n8349" type="main" key="circumva_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vādo</orth>, <itype>vāsi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attack on every side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beset</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n8349.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: aliquem clamoribus turbidis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeuntem noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, ofterror falling upon one (so only a few times in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">novus terror cum ex parte utrāque circumvasisset aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 38, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvagor: <entryFree id="n8350" type="main" key="circumva^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-văgor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n8350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl>. <pb n="343" /> <cb n="CIRC" /></sense></entryFree>
circumvagus: <entryFree id="n8351" type="main" key="circumva^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing around</hi> (very rare): oceanus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:41" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 41</bibl>; cf. Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 814</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvallo: <entryFree id="n8352" type="main" key="circumvallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surround with a wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to circumvallate;</hi> in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to blockade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass in a hostile manner</hi> (class., esp. in the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">circumvallare loci natura prohibebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35, 12</bibl> and 15; 28, 3, 4, and in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 19, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8352.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot res repente circumvallant,</quote> <trans><tr>beset</tr>, <tr>beleaguer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8352.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum duobus sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula fluctisono circumvallata profundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 358</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvectio: <entryFree id="n8353" type="main" key="circumvecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumveho</etym> (only twice in Cic.). <sense id="n8353.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A carrying around</hi> (of merchandise), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8353.1" n="II" level="1"> Solis, <hi rend="ital">the circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvectitor: <entryFree id="n8354" type="hapax" key="circumvecti^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumvectĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n8354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep. a.</hi> [circum-vectito], <hi rend="ital">to travel about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visit in succession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida circumvectitabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
circumvecto: <entryFree id="n8355" type="main" key="circumvecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:291" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 291</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8355.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., mid., <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sail around</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Ligurum oram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. circumvectitor.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">+ugit irreparabile tempus, Singula dum capti circumvectamur amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 285</bibl></cit> (dum speciatim cuncta describimus, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>
circumvectus: <entryFree id="n8356" type="main" key="circumvectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of circumvehor.</entryFree>
circumvehor: <entryFree id="n8357" type="main" key="circumve^hor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vĕhor</orth>, <itype>vectus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n8357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ride around</hi> (in a carriage or on horseback), <hi rend="ital">to sail around</hi> (class., but not in Cic.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>acc.</case> dependent on circum: <cit><quote lang="la">in terras orasque ultimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare superum omne Graeciamque exoticam... Sumus circumvecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: classe Pharon, Auct. B. Alex. 14; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classe ad Romanum agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvectus Brundisii promunturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab urbe ad aversa insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitibus ad diripienda hostis impedimenta circumvehi jussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus circumvecti milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites circumvectos ab tergo Gallicam invadere aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 29, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 59: muliones collibus circumvehi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex circumvectus petram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvehens Peloponnesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8357.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse (very rare): frustra circumvehor omnia verbis (i. e. <hi rend="ital">I describe at large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to express by circumlocution</hi>, circumeo), <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 270</bibl> Sillig (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 285</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvectamur): latius in dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvelo: <entryFree id="n8358" type="hapax" key="circumve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurato circumvelatur amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvenio: <entryFree id="n8359" type="main" key="circumve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n8359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come around something;</hi> hence (the coming being considered as accomplished; cf. advenio and adventus, II.). </sense><sense id="n8359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8359.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be around</hi> (a thing), <hi rend="ital">to encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus succensis circumventi flammā exanimantur homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">donec ignium jactu circumveniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum frequentia ingens circumvenit cum plausu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92, 8</bibl></cit>: Cocytos sinu labens circumvenit atro, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium operum magnitudinem circumveniunt cavernae ingentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus insulas circumveniens,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities locis paulo superioribus circumventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami, quos comprehensos manus possit circumvenire,</quote> <trans><tr>to grasp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 29, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:400" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 400</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>to go around from one city to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 4</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—Far more freq. (esp. in the histt.), </sense><sense id="n8359.3" n="B" level="2"> Specif., <hi rend="ital">to surround in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex itinere nostros latere aperto aggressi circumvenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne per insidias ab eo circumveniretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: aciem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos ab tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta moenia exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio circumventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 26, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl>, <cb n="CIRC" /> 2, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis regiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 50</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 16: cerva circumventa lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:165" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostili custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8359.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8359.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>: circumventus morbo, exilio atque inopiā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 58, 218</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 62</bibl> (Trag. v. 42 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 46: quasi committeret contra legem, quo quis judicio circumveniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:31" default="NO">6, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem per arbitrum circumvenire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lay hold of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc.
