Com. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam te non Siculi, non aratores circumveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te a Siciliae civitatibus circumveniri atque opprimi dicis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">17: potentis alicujus opibus circumveniri urgerique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque tenuiores proper humilitatem circumveniantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 85</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">falsis criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus necessitudinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his difficultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio accolarum, simul domesticis discordiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitate pacis et belli malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: multa senem circumveniunt incommoda, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8359.6" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. circumeo, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">To circumvent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defraud one</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">decipio, fraudo, fallo): circumventum esse innocentem pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 29, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an placeret, fenore circumventa plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falso testimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine calliditate circumventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:28:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 3, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8359.7" n="2" level="3"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to evade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to violate by evading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:123:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 123, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:29" default="NO">1, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem defuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:29" default="NO">1, 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8359.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To obtain possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grasp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne stagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumventio: <entryFree id="n8360" type="main" key="circumventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumvenio, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n8360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circumventing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauding</hi> (postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adversarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 43, 3</bibl>: innocentium, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 22.</sense></entryFree>
circumventor: <entryFree id="n8361" type="hapax" key="circumventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumventorius: <entryFree id="n8362" type="hapax" key="circumvento_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumventōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumventor</etym>, <sense id="n8362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumventus: <entryFree id="n8363" type="main" key="circumventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumventus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumvenio.</entryFree>
circumverro: <entryFree id="n8364" type="main" key="circumverro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-verro</orth>, v. circumversus.</entryFree>
circumversio: <entryFree id="n8365" type="main" key="circumversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumverto</etym>, <sense id="n8365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moving around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): manus (in gesturing), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 105</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus annui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumverso: <entryFree id="n8366" type="main" key="circumverso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-verso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum verso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorso</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn around</hi> (rare and only <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in mid. sense): <cit><quote lang="la">quaerentesque viam circumversantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:200" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1528</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumversus: <entryFree id="n8367" type="hapax" key="circumversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-versus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [verro], <sense id="n8367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brushed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swept around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus purus, circumversus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumverto: <entryFree id="n8368" type="main" key="circumverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-verto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn around</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): citius quam rotula circumvortitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: rota circumvertitur axem, <hi rend="ital">turns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is turned around on its axis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 522</bibl> (Merkel, circumvolvitur): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi circumvortor, cado,</quote> <trans><tr>turn myself around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: circumvertens se, <hi rend="ital">turning one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to the right side</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the commentt. in h. l.: mancipium,</quote> <trans><tr>to declare free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 342" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 342</bibl></cit>; v. circumago, I. B. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 127</bibl>, perh. a false reading for intervortant, which Fleck. adopts; cf. Lorenz ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
circumvestio: <entryFree id="n8369" type="main" key="circumvesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n8369.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To clothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl></cit>.—In a figure: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amictu prudentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 12, 48</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8369.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of one who uses language to conceal his thoughts: se circumvestire dictis, <hi rend="ital">to wrap himself up in words</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 158</bibl> (Trag. Rel. inc. v. 113 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
circumvincio: <entryFree id="n8370" type="main" key="circumvinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vincĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n8370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>vinctum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bind around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncis murteta, aliquem virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumviso: <entryFree id="n8371" type="hapax" key="circumvi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vīso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look around at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glare round upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">set angues oculis omnis circumvisere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvolitabilis: <entryFree id="n8372" type="hapax" key="circumvo^li^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circumvŏlĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>circumvolito</etym>, <sense id="n8372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 584</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CIRC" /></sense></entryFree>
circumvolito: <entryFree id="n8373" type="main" key="circumvo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vŏlĭto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circum vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (mostly post-Aug.). <sense id="n8373.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to fly around something</hi>: lacus circumvolitavit hirundo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 377</bibl>: thyma, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 21</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvolitantium alitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8373.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., of men, <hi rend="ital">to rove about a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hover around; absol.</hi>: et circumvolitant equites, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 329</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:420" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 420</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina potentiorum, Col. praef. 1, § 9: agmina infestorum equitum ad conquirendas proscriptorum latebras circumvolitantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvolo: <entryFree id="n8374" type="main" key="circumvo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n8374.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to fly around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba (Harpyiae) praedam circumvolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu (me) mors atris circumvolat alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 866</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 719</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 507</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: aliquem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nave circumvolatā ab halcyone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 32, 47, § 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8374.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculo campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 416</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvoluto: <entryFree id="n8375" type="hapax" key="circumvo^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-vŏlūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi> force, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 21, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circumvolvo: <entryFree id="n8376" type="main" key="circumvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circum-volvo</orth>, no <sense id="n8376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, only with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or mid., <hi rend="ital">to roll one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roll round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twine around</hi> (prob. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid or alicui rei: magnum sol circumvolvitur annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota perpetuum circumvolvitur axem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 522</bibl></cit> Merkel: <cit><quote lang="la">herba arboribus circumvolvens se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes circumvolutae sibi ipsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 88, § 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circus: <entryFree id="n8377" type="main" key="circus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/rkos</foreign> [kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">kri/kos</foreign>; Dor. <foreign lang="greek">ki/rkos</foreign>, and <foreign lang="greek">korw/nh</foreign>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">kulinde/w, kullo/s</foreign>, cirrus, curvus]. <sense id="n8377.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A circular line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circle</hi>, in astronomy (less freq. than circulus): quot luna circos annuo in cursu institit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circus lacteus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Milky Way</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">candens circus, Lacteus hic notatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=248" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 248</bibl></cit> (492): <cit><quote lang="la">illum incolunt locum ... erat autem is splendidissimo candore inter flammas circus elucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">globus et circi zonaeque ac fulgida signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 583</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8377.1" n="II" level="1"> Circus Maximus, and more freq. <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign> Circus, <hi rend="ital">the oval circus built by Tarquinius Priscus between the Palatine and Aventine hills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which could contain more than one hundred thousand spectators.</hi> It was surrounded by galleries three stories high, and a canal called Euripus. Through its whole length, in the middle, a wall four feet high and about twelve broad was built, called spina, at the ends of which there were three columns upon one base (meta), around which the combatants were required to pass seven times before the prize was awarded. In the middle of the spina, Cæsar erected the obelisk, 132 feet high, brought from Egypt; cf. Dion. Hal. 3, 68; Dict. Antiq. p. 252 sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 467 sq.—Passages with Circus Maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:392" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 24, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:5 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 5 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">Circus Magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 71</bibl>.—Most freq. only Circus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 72 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl> et saep.—In or around the Circus many jugglers and soothsayers, etc., stationed themselves; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Circus fallax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circus clamosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:53:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 53, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 65</bibl>. —Besides the Circus Maximus, there were at Rome still other Circi, among which the most celebrated was the Circus Flaminius in the ninth region, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=154" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 7, § 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called only Circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:205" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 209</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 598; <cit><quote lang="la">and the Circus Vaticanus, begun by Caligula and finished by Nero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Vaticani Gai et Neronis principuus circo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 11, 15, § 74</bibl></cit>.—Also, without the walls of Rome, Circus maritimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8377.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Circensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Circus</hi>: ludi, <hi rend="ital">the contesls in the</hi> Circus Maximus, also called ludi magni (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 9, 10 al.</bibl>; cf. Baumg.Crus.<pb n="344" /> <cb n="CISA" />  ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicrum, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Circensis pompa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Circenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ludi; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 458): edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circensium die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeii, prepared by the ediles annually in November,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8377.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any race-course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 289</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 551</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:313" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:323" default="NO">16, 323</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:247" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 247</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8377.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spectators in the circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:535" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciris: <entryFree id="n8378" type="greek" key="ci_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kei=ris</foreign>, <sense id="n8378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird</hi> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 198" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 198</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">a fish</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">ki/rris</foreign>, Etym. M.), <hi rend="ital">into which Scylla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Nisus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was changed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 488 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cirratus: <entryFree id="n8379" type="main" key="cirra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cirrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cirrus</etym>. <sense id="n8379.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Curled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having ringlets</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cir-rāti</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:29" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8379.1" n="II" level="1"> Vestes, <hi rend="ital">fringed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cirrha: <entryFree id="n8380" type="main" key="Cirrha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cirrha</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cirra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/rra</foreign>, <sense id="n8380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Delphi</hi>, devoted to Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:474" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 474</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 172</bibl>; Mart, 1, 77; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8380.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cirrhaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cirraeus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cirrha</hi>, or (in post-Aug. poets freq.) <hi rend="ital">to Apollo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirrhaea vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Delphi</tr>, <tr>Delphic</tr>, <tr>of the Pythia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 269" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 269</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:106" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirrhaeus vates,</quote> <trans><tr>of Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the Delphic oracle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:331" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cirritus: <entryFree id="n8381" type="main" key="cirri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cirrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cirrus</etym>, <sense id="n8381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having filaments</hi>: pirum, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pear</hi>, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cirrus: <entryFree id="n8382" type="main" key="cirrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cirrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (used mostly in <number>plur.</number>), <sense id="n8382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (natural) <hi rend="ital">lock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ringlet</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tuft of hair</hi> (rare): cirri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 83</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cirrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 165</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the hair on the forehead of a horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8382.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8382.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tuft of feathers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crest of birds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8382.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The arms of polypi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 28, 44, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 33, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 37, § 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8382.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Filaments of plants similar to tufts of hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 20, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 9, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8382.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fringe upon a tunic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 13</bibl>; cf. cirratus, II.</sense></entryFree>
cirsion: <entryFree id="n8383" type="greek" key="cirsi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cirsĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/rsion</foreign>, <sense id="n8383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 39, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cirta: <entryFree id="n8384" type="main" key="Cirta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cirta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/rta</foreign>, <sense id="n8384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important town in Numidia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Constantine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 3, 2, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:101:1" default="NO" valid="yes">101, 1</bibl>; 102, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 14 al.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cirten-ses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:9:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 6, 9, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cis: <entryFree id="n8385" type="main" key="cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cis</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>pronom. stem ki-, whence -ce; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)-kei=</foreign>; cf.: hic, sic, etc.</etym> (far more rare than the kindr. citra), <sense id="n8385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on this side</hi> (opp. uls, ultra, and trans; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 83</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 33, 9 al.</bibl>); with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n8385.1" n="I" level="1"> In space. </sense><sense id="n8385.2" n="A" level="2"> With verb of motion (rare): eo die cis Tiberim redeundum est, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 92, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8385.3" n="B" level="2"> With verb of rest: Oppius mons, terticeps cis lucum Exquilinum, Sacr. Argae. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Tiberim redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia cis Rhenum perdomita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 8</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cis Taurum sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Euphratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos, qui cis Rhenum incolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: hic primus cis Anienem cum rege Veientium conflixit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Taurum montem usque ad Halyn amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Padum ultraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8385.4" n="II" level="1"> In time, <hi rend="ital">within</hi> (only in Plaut. and post-class. writers; <cit><quote lang="la">in the former always in connection with pauci): cis dies paucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos cis mensīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cis paucas tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis pauculos dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. Jul. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis mensem decimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 42:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8385.5" n="III" level="1"> Acc. to Priscian, also in other designations of limits = intra: <cit><quote lang="la">cis naturae leges, ut ultra naturae leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 987</bibl></cit> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">but the only passage cited for this meaning is: veniam petens, quod ei cis Vettios, Plautios dissimulavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 30</bibl></cit> Ritter (Halm: ei Titios, Vettios; al. aliter), a very corrupt passage.</sense></entryFree>
cisalpinus: <entryFree id="n8386" type="main" key="Cisalpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cis-alpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying on this side of the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cisalpine</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl>: <cb n="CIST" /> Galli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 38, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cisiarius: <entryFree id="n8387" type="main" key="ci^si^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭsĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cisium</etym>. <sense id="n8387.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The driver of a cabriolet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: CISIARIEI, C. I. L. 1, 1165.—</sense><sense id="n8387.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The maker of a cabriolet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cisium: <entryFree id="n8388" type="main" key="ci^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light two-wheeled vehicle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cabriolet</hi> (vehiculi biroti genus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 30</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> cisi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 3</bibl> Burm.; cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 9; Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
cismontanus: <entryFree id="n8389" type="hapax" key="cismonta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cis-montānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situate on this side of the mountain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aufinates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cisorium: <entryFree id="n8390" type="hapax" key="ci_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n8390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting instrument</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cispellam: <entryFree id="n8391" type="spur" key="cispellam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cispellam</orth>, a false read. for aspellam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 17</bibl>.</entryFree>
cispius: <entryFree id="n8392" type="main" key="Cispi^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cispĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman gentile name;</hi> e. g. M. Cispius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 75 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8393" type="main" key="Cispi^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cispĭus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cespĭus</orth>, old form in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl> Müll.): mons, <sense id="n8393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the peaks of the</hi> Mons Esquilinus, now the church <hi rend="ital">S. Maria Maggiore</hi>, Varr. L. L. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348, 28</bibl>; p. 351, 1; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 11</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 534 sq.</sense></entryFree>
cisrhenanus: <entryFree id="n8394" type="main" key="Cisrhe_na_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cis-rhēnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situate on this side of the Rhine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cissanthemos: <entryFree id="n8395" type="greek" key="cissanthe^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cissanthĕmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kissa/nqemos</foreign>, <sense id="n8395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant similar to ivy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> cyclaminos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 68, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:156" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cissaros: <entryFree id="n8396" type="greek" key="cissa^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cissărŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant also called</hi> chrysanthemon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cisseis: <entryFree id="n8397" type="main" key="Cisse_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cissēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Cisseus.</entryFree>
cisseus: <entryFree id="n8398" type="main" key="Cisseus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cisseus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kisseu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n8398.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Thrace;</hi> acc. to a later myth, <hi rend="ital">father of Hecuba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 537</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 91" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:911" default="NO">911</bibl>; who is on this account called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cissēïs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 320</bibl> Serv.; 10, 705.—</sense><sense id="n8398.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Turnus</hi>, <case>acc.</case> Cissea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 317</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cission: <entryFree id="n8399" type="greek" key="cissi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cissĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kissi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n8399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small ivy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cissis: <entryFree id="n8400" type="main" key="Cissis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cissis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60, 7 sq.</bibl> Alschefski ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
cissitis: <entryFree id="n8401" type="greek" key="cissi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cissītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kissi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n8401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of ivy-leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cissos: <entryFree id="n8402" type="greek" key="cisso^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cissŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kisso/s</foreign>. <sense id="n8402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ivy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8402.1" n="II" level="1"> Cissos erythranos, <hi rend="ital">an ivylike plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 49, § 82</bibl>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">cissybĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kissu/bion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cup of ivy-wood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cista: <entryFree id="n8403" type="greek" key="cista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/sth</foreign>, <sense id="n8403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often woven of slips</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used for keeping money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n8403.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:209" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 197</bibl>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 54, 2</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:206" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:44" default="NO">6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8403.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8403.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In mystical religious festivals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a box for holding the sacred utensils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 609</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:267" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 262.—</sense><sense id="n8403.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A box for depositing the votes in assemblies of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 7, § 31</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 91, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl>; Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
cistella: <entryFree id="n8404" type="main" key="cistella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cista</etym>, <sense id="n8404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small chest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">box</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 3</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 65 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl> dub. (al. sitella).</sense></entryFree>
cistellaria: <entryFree id="n8405" type="main" key="Cistella_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cistellārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cistella</etym>, <sense id="n8405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Plautus;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 63, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cistellatrix: <entryFree id="n8406" type="hapax" key="cistella_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistellātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who has charge of the money-box</hi> (a kind of female slave), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 25</bibl> (253 Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
cistellula: <entryFree id="n8407" type="main" key="cistellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 141</bibl> Ussing (Fleck. cistula); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cisterna: <entryFree id="n8408" type="main" key="cisterna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cisterna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cista</etym>, <sense id="n8408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subterranean reservoir for water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cistern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 21, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:173" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 23, 52, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:56:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 56, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 12 al.</bibl>—For preserving wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:21:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 21, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cisterninus: <entryFree id="n8409" type="main" key="cisterni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cisternīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cisterna</etym>, <sense id="n8409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to cisterns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cistern-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8, 3</bibl>. <cb n="CITE" /></sense></entryFree>
cisthena: <entryFree id="n8410" type="main" key="Cisthe_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cisthēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kisqh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n8410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Æolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cisthos: <entryFree id="n8411" type="greek" key="cisthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cisthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/sqos</foreign> (usu. <foreign lang="greek">ki/stos</foreign>), <sense id="n8411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrubby plant with red blossoms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 48, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cistiberis: <entryFree id="n8412" type="main" key="Cisti^be^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cis-tĭbĕris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = cis Tiberim, <sense id="n8412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on this side of the Tiber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueviri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 33</bibl></cit>: magistratus, Pomp. Orig. Jus. § 33 Osann.</sense></entryFree>
cistifer: <entryFree id="n8413" type="hapax" key="cisti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cista-fero</etym>, <sense id="n8413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bearer of a box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cistophorus: <entryFree id="n8414" type="greek" key="cisto^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistŏphŏrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kistofo/ros</foreign>. <sense id="n8414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The bearer of the sacred box</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2318</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8414.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Asiatic coin of the value of about four drachms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which a</hi> cista <hi rend="ital">was stamped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 20, 52</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> cistophorūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 46, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 7, 1</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cistula: <entryFree id="n8415" type="main" key="cistu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cistŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cista</etym>, <sense id="n8415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">basket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 38</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citarini: <entryFree id="n8416" type="main" key="Ci_ta_ri^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cītārĭni</orth>, v. Cetarini.</entryFree>
citate: <entryFree id="n8417" type="main" key="ci^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. cito, <sense id="n8417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
citatim: <entryFree id="n8418" type="main" key="ci^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>citatus, cito</etym>, <sense id="n8418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi> (very rare), Auct. B. Afr. 80; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, v. 2. cito <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
citatio: <entryFree id="n8419" type="main" key="ci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. cito</etym>. <sense id="n8419.0" n="I" level="1"> In law, <hi rend="ital">the calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaiming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictorum sollemnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 12, 6, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8419.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the command</hi>, Hyg. Grom. § 43, p. 91.</sense></entryFree>
citatorium: <entryFree id="n8420" type="hapax" key="ci^ta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. cito</etym>, <sense id="n8420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summoning before a tribunal</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 28, 5.</sense></entryFree>
citatus: <entryFree id="n8421" type="main" key="ci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. <itype>cito</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
cite: <entryFree id="n8422" type="main" key="ci^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cieo, <sense id="n8422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
citer: <entryFree id="n8423" type="main" key="ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype> (<sense id="n8423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> citerior; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> citimus; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">comp.;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> only Cato ap. Prisc. pp. 589 and 999 P.; and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> ib.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8423.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">On this side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citer agnus (ager) alligatus ad sacra erit, Cato ap. Prisc. pp. 599 and 989 P.: alter ulteriorem Galliam decernit cum Syriā, alter citeriorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citerior provincia (i. e. Gallia Cisalpina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliā citeriore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citerior Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:46" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.2" n="II" level="1"> As that which is on this side is nearer to us than its opposite, <hi rend="ital">lying near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8423.3" n="A" level="2"> In space: <cit><quote lang="la">(stella) ultima a caelo, citima terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citima Persidis (sc. loca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 213</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8423.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduc orationem tuam de caelo ad haec citeriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:21:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 21, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā animi tranquillitate humana et citeriora considerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad haec citeriora veniam et notiora nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam citeriora nondum audiebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:6" default="NO">9, 12, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citerioris vitae minister,</quote> <trans><tr>private</tr>, <tr>domestic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.5" n="B" level="2"> In time (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africano consulatus citerior legitimo tempore datus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:11" default="NO">6, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in antiquius citeriusve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citeriore die (opp. longiore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.6" n="C" level="2"> In measure or degree, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citerior tamen est poena quam scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 299" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl>, ext. 10.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.: comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĕrĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citerius debito resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĭmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">least</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1016</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n8423.7" n="III" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n8423.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">on this side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the hither</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nearer side</hi> (opp. to ultra; more freq. than cis, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n8423.9" n="1" level="3"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8423.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dextera) nec citra mota nec ultra,</quote> <trans><tr>neither this way nor that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 186</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra citraque pervolare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra est Oglasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra fuere margines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani qui essent citra Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is locus est citra Leucadem stadia CXX.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">citra Veliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare citra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra flumen intercepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra Tauri juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 48, 1 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">With verbs of motion: ut exercitum citra flumen Rubiconem educeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes citra flumen eliceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 106</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8423.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to citer, II.) Of that which takes <pb n="345" /> <cb n="CITE" /> place, or is within a fixed boundary, and yet does not reach that boundary, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">less than.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8423.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erit necesse id usque a capite arcessere: saepe etiam citra licet,</quote> <trans><tr>not so far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:9:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis citra milibus lignatores ei occurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra quam proxime fuerint (defectus lunae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra exsultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 180</bibl></cit>: tela citra cadebant (i. e. <hi rend="ital">did not reach</hi> the Romans), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec a postremā syllabā citra tertiam,</quote> <trans><tr>before the third syllable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 58</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 30</bibl>: acuta intra numerum trium syllabarum continetur); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Veneris stella numquam longius XLVI. portibus ab sole... abscedant, saepe citra eas ad solem reciprocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.15" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8423.16" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> of measure: <cit><quote lang="la">neve domi praesume dapes et desine citra Quam capias paulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 757</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">culta citra quam debuit illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 7, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: pronepos ego regis aquarum; <cit><quote lang="la">Nec virtus citra genus est,</quote> <trans><tr>is not behind my family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans cum citra satietatem data est,</quote> <trans><tr>not to satiety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fatigationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra necem tua constitit ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus citra intellectum acrimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8423.18" n="c" level="4"> In time (with <case>acc.</case> rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not anteAug.): citra Kalendas Octobris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojana tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.19" n="3" level="3"> Since the Aug. per. (most freq. in Quint. and Pliny the elder; in the former more than twenty times), in gen. of that which does not belong to, is without, or beyond something, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aside from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without regard to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting aside</hi> (for the class. sine, praeter; hence the Gloss.: <foreign lang="greek">a)/neu</foreign> sine, absque, praeter, citra, Gloss. Cyr.; citra <foreign lang="greek">di/xa, xwri/s, e)kto/s</foreign>, Gloss. Phil.); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra hoc experimentum multa sunt, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus usus sine doctrinā, quam citra usum doctrina valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phidias in ebore longe citra aemulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus citra virtutem intellegi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:21" default="NO">3, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:3" default="NO">7, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranare aquas citra docentem natura ipsa sciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 29, 30, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra ullum aliud incommodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:225 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 225 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra speciem aut delectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra Senatūs populique auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda emeritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem omnium fortuna cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam citra spectaculorum dies,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>even out of the time of the established spectacles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra magnitudinem prope Ponto similis,</quote> <trans><tr>excepting its size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 22</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl>: lana tincta fuco citra purpuras placet, Ov.
