Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl>.—Citra sometimes follows its case, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8423.20" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (orig. <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi>), always in the connection and position ultro citroque, ultro et citro, ultro ac citro, or without copula ultro citro (not ultroque citroque), <hi rend="ital">hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this way and that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards and forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocally;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">par ci par là</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ça et là</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ultro ac citro commeare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursum deorsum, ultro citro commeantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 84</bibl></cit>: ultro citroque commeare, Auct. B. Afr. 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 104</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ultro citroque navigarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursare ultro et citro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl></cit> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1011</bibl> P., perh. only from memory written ultro citroque): <cit><quote lang="la">bis ultro citroque transcurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 7 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepe ultro citroque legati inter eos mitterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis verbis ultro citroque habitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiis ultro citro datis acceptisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut obsides ultro citroque darentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datā ultro citroque fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inplicati ultro et citro vel usu diuturno vel etiam officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit> Klotz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: alternatis ultro citro aestibus, Sen. <cb n="CITO" /> Q. N. 4, 2, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro citroque versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
citeria: <entryFree id="n8424" type="main" key="ci^te^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effigy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caricature carried in procession at the games</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 20</bibl> Müll.; Cato ib.</sense></entryFree>
citerior: <entryFree id="n8425" type="main" key="ci^te^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĕrĭor</orth>, v. citer.</entryFree>
citerius: <entryFree id="n8426" type="main" key="ci^te^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĕrĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. citer.</entryFree>
cithaeron: <entryFree id="n8427" type="main" key="Ci^thaeron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭthaeron</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭthĕron</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 32</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kiqairw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n8427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Elatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Bacchus and the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and famous for the death of Pentheus and Actœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 223</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 702</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 930" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 930</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:81" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 81</bibl> (in all these passages only in <case>nom.</case>).—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Cithaeronis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 43; 3 (4), 15, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Cithaeronem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 641</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 291</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cithara: <entryFree id="n8428" type="greek" key="ci^tha^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqa/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n8428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cithara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cithern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guitar</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lute</hi> (very freq. in the poets, esp. in Hor.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:981" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 981</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:2" default="NO">2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 776</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 4</bibl>; Varr. L. L. S, § 61 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:10" default="NO">1, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:15" default="NO">2, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 65 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8428.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the music of the cithara</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">of a stringed instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the art of playing on the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 10, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 104</bibl> and 105.</sense></entryFree>
citharicen: <entryFree id="n8429" type="gloss" key="ci^tha^ri^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthărĭcen</orth>, <itype>cĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cithara-cano; cf. tubicen</etym>, <sense id="n8429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the player on the cithara</hi> (unused); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 61</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
citharista: <entryFree id="n8430" type="greek" key="ci^tha^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthărista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqaristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the cithara</hi> (mostly in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a statue of a player on the cithara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam illum Aspendium citharistam, de quo saepe audistis id quod est Graecis hominibus in proverbio, quem omnia intus canere dicebant, sustulit, i. e. he was so skilfully represented that he seemed to be playing the music inwardly, though it was unheard,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 53</bibl></cit> Zumpt ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
citharistria: <entryFree id="n8431" type="greek" key="ci^tha^ristri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthăristrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqari/stria</foreign>, <sense id="n8431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who plays on the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 2</bibl>; Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citharizo: <entryFree id="n8432" type="greek" key="ci^tha^ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthărīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v n.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqari/zw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to play on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strike the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citharoeda: <entryFree id="n8433" type="gloss" key="ci^tha^roeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthăroeda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v citharoedus.</entryFree>
citharoedicus: <entryFree id="n8434" type="greek" key="ci^tha^roedi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthăroedĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqarw|diko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the citharœdi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:127" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
citharoedus: <entryFree id="n8435" type="greek" key="ci^tha^roedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthăroedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kiqarw|do/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plays on the cithara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanying it with the voice</hi> (diff. from citharista by the accompanying singing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 355</bibl>; Quint 1, 12, 3; 4, 1, 2; 11, 3, 88; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4 al.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CITHAROEDA, ae,</quote> <trans><tr>she who plays on and sings to the cithara</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2611</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8435.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnes, qui habent citharam, sunt citharoedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭthărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/qaros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fish of the sole kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citiensis: <entryFree id="n8436" type="main" key="Ci^ti^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭensis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Citt-</orth>), v. Citium</entryFree>
citime: <entryFree id="n8437" type="main" key="ci^ti^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi>, v. citer.</sense></entryFree>
citipes: <entryFree id="n8438" type="hapax" key="ci^ti^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>citus</etym>, <sense id="n8438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftfooted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>: cursus, Diom, p. 472 P.</sense></entryFree>
citiremis: <entryFree id="n8439" type="hapax" key="ci^ti^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtĭrēmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>citus - remus</etym>, <sense id="n8439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rowed swiftly</hi>: Argo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 94</bibl> P</sense></entryFree>
citium: <entryFree id="n8440" type="main" key="Ci^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭum</orth> (more rare <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cittĭum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/tion (*ki/ttion</foreign>). <sense id="n8440.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seaport town in Cyprus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Khiti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the Stoic Zeno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8440.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Citian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8440.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8440.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 1</bibl> and 2.</sense></entryFree>
citius: <entryFree id="n8441" type="main" key="Ci^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (mons), <sense id="n8441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cito: <entryFree id="n8442" type="main" key="ci^to^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtŏ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cieo, <sense id="n8442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8443" type="main" key="ci^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n8443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf. gen. plur.</hi> citatūm, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 485</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> citarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 42</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>cieo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8443.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <cb n="CITO" /> <hi rend="ital">put into quick motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drive violently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promote</hi>, etc. (mostly post-Aug. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in earlier authors usu. only in <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">citat hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:583" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:124" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>, n. 13: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi luctandi juvenes animosa citavit gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:834" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 834</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8443.2" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:2" default="NO">4, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Feb. 9, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8443.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">isque motus (animi) aut boni aut mali opinione citetur,</quote> <trans><tr>be called forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 24</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">motus cieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n8443.4" n="II" level="1"> (Like cieo, 2.) With reference to the termination ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to urge to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summon to</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in lang. of business; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: voco, adesse jubeo): patres in curiam per praeconem ad regem Tarquinium citari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 38, 6</bibl> and 12: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fora citatis senatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus ad sacramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices citati in hunc reum consedistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citari nominatim unum ex iis, etc., i. e. for enrollment for milit. service,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; id. Epit. libr. 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8443.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8443.6" n="1" level="3"> In law, <hi rend="ital">to call the parties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see whether they are present</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus vocare, evocare): citat reum: non respondet. Citat accusatorem... citatus accusator non respondit, non affuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:40:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 40, § 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 38, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of those accused,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61</bibl>.—And of the roll of a gang of slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia ergastuli cottidie per nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 22 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equester ordo reus a consulibus citaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and facetiously,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the charge or penalty: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ii... abs te capitis C. Rabirii nomine citantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne proditi mysterii reus a philosophis citaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of witnesses: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc rem testem totam Siciliam citabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8443.7" n="b" level="4"> Beyond the sphere of judicial proceedings: testem, auctorem, <hi rend="ital">to call one to witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis citetur Salamis clarissimae testis victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego testes citaturus fui rerum a me gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtas ad testimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri, quos Macer Licinius citat identidem auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To call for votes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinions</hi> in the senate, haec illi, quo quisque ordine citabantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 18</bibl>.—Of an appeal to a god for aid, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:683" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8443.8" n="2" level="3"> (Like cieo, II. C.) In gen., <hi rend="ital">to mention any person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing by name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. laudo): omnes Danai reliquique Graeci, qui hoc anapaesto citantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: victorem Olympiae citari; cf. Nep. praef. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:922" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 922</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeanem,</quote> <trans><tr>to rehearse</tr>, <tr>recite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">io Bacche,</quote> <trans><tr>to call</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 12</bibl></cit>, infra cieo, II. C. 2.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 22</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urged on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurried; and P a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi> (opp. tardus; class.). </sense><sense id="n8443.9" n="A" level="2"> Prop., freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">citato equo,</quote> <trans><tr>at full gallop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 46, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:373 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 373 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citato gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatum agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatiore agmine ad stativa sua pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 50, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">citatissimo agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 6, 10 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis citatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 178" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1048" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1048</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 456</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:663" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euro citatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus citatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>.—Also instead of an <pos>adv.</pos> (cf. citus, B.): <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus per fines Trevirorum citatus fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt citati signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penna citatior ibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:11" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8443.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta acria et citata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:135" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 135</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to persons: in argumentis citati atque ipso etiam motu celeres sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roscius citatior, Aesopus gravior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>, <pb n="346" /> <cb n="CIVI" /> 3, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio (opp. pressa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatior manus (opp. lenior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soni tum placidi tum citati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. examples): <cit><quote lang="la">piscatores citatius moventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut versus quam citatissime volvant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
citocacium: <entryFree id="n8444" type="main" key="cito^ca^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">citŏcăcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> chamelaea, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citra: <entryFree id="n8445" type="main" key="ci_^tra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trā</orth>, v. <itype>citer</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, A.</entryFree>
citrago: <entryFree id="n8446" type="main" key="ci_^tra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trāgo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtrĕāgo</orth> in MSS.), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>citrus</etym>, <sense id="n8446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the citrus-plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lemon-balm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citrarius: <entryFree id="n8447" type="gloss" key="ci_^tra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in lemons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4811</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citratus: <entryFree id="n8448" type="hapax" key="ci_^tra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>citrus</etym>, <sense id="n8448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steeped in citrus-oil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8449" type="main" key="ci_^tra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>a late <pos>adj.</pos> form of citra</etym>, <sense id="n8449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of this side</hi>, Auct. Limit. p. 298 sq.</sense></entryFree>
citretum: <entryFree id="n8450" type="hapax" key="ci_^tre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trētum</orth>. <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>citrus</etym>, <sense id="n8450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orchard of citrus-trees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citreus: <entryFree id="n8451" type="main" key="ci_^tre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trĕus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8451.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the citrus-tree</hi>: mālus, <hi rend="ital">the citrustree</hi>, Opp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>: malum, <hi rend="ital">citrusapple</hi>, Cloat. ib.: mensa, <hi rend="ital">of citrus-wood</hi> (which was much prized by the ancients), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub trabe citreā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit> Zumpt; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 45, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8451.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtrĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = ci-trus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 44, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8451.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the citron-tree;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtrĕ-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the citron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 56, § 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citrium: <entryFree id="n8452" type="main" key="citri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">citrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gourd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO">4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
citro: <entryFree id="n8453" type="main" key="ci_^tro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>citer</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, B.</entryFree>
citrosus: <entryFree id="n8454" type="main" key="ci_^tro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>citrus</etym>, <sense id="n8454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smelling of citrus</hi>: vestis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15, 5</bibl> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">ei(/mata quw/dea</foreign>, Hom. Od. 5, 264 al.; in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 14</bibl> Müll. erron.: citrosa vestis appellata est a similitudine citri; so also <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
citrum: <entryFree id="n8455" type="main" key="ci_^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wood of the citrus</hi>, q. v., <hi rend="ital">citrus-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8455.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the household furniture</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">tables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of it</hi> (very costly), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242:21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242, 21</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:59:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 59, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:6" default="NO">10, 98, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:80:2" default="NO">10, 80, 2</bibl>; cf. citrus, I.</sense></entryFree>
citrus: <entryFree id="n8456" type="greek" key="ci_^trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cī^trus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> <etym>prob. a mutilation of <foreign lang="greek">ke/dros</foreign>, cedrus</etym>. <sense id="n8456.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The citrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an African tree</hi> (hence Atlantis silva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 144</bibl>, and Massyla robora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 94</bibl>), whose very fragrant wood (v. citrum) was used in making household furniture, and was prized very highly, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:91 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 91 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 16, 30, § 100</bibl>; Varr R. R. 3, 2, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 428</bibl>; cf. citreus, I. and citrum.—</sense><sense id="n8456.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The citrontree</hi> (also called malus Medica, Persica, etc.), Citrus Medica, Linn., whose fruit and leaves were laid between the folds of clothing to preserve it from worms; <cit><quote lang="la">and also used as a counter-poison,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 14 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 16, 31, § 103</bibl>; Cloat. and Opp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cittium: <entryFree id="n8457" type="main" key="Cittium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cittium</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cittiensis</orth>, etc., v. Citium.</entryFree>
citus: <entryFree id="n8458" type="main" key="ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>cieo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
civicus: <entryFree id="n8459" type="main" key="ci_vi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>civis</etym>. <sense id="n8459.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to citizens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citizens</hi> (more rare than the class. civilis, and, except in the phrase civica corona, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:126" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma pro trepidis reis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>defence before a tribunal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8459.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. corona civica, <hi rend="ital">the civic crown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of oak leaves</hi> (hence, civilis quercus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 772</bibl>, and querna corona. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:614" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 614</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 36</bibl>), the crown of highest distinction, except the corona obsidionalis, and bestowed upon him who had saved the life of a fellow-citizen in war; <cit><quote lang="la">its inscription was: OB CIVEM (CIVES) SERVATVM (SERVATOS),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 3, § 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 3, 6</bibl>; Liv 10, 46, 3, Dict. of Antiq. p 310. —Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">civicam mereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem civicā donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servati civis decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8459.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a town</hi> or <hi rend="ital">city</hi>: errare intra muros civicos, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> <hi rend="ital">P.</hi> (in Liv. <cb n="CIVI" /> 1, 40, 2, vicinae, not civicae, is the true reading).—No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
civilis: <entryFree id="n8460" type="main" key="ci_vi_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>civis</etym>. <sense id="n8460.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to citizens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civic</hi> (class. in prose and poetry, and very freq.): sanguine civili rem conflant, <hi rend="ital">by the blood of citizens</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:7" default="NO">3, 23, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—So De Bello Civili, the title of a portion of the Commentaries of Julius Cæsar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidii specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mos consuetudoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41,148</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">just before: instituta civilia: conciliatio et societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus = corona civica (v. civicus, I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 772</bibl></cit>: civilis dies, <hi rend="ital">the civil day</hi> (<hi rend="ital">from midnight to midnight;</hi> opp. to the naturalis dies, from the rising to the setting of the sun), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 77, 79, § 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor (opp. to naturalis),</quote> <trans><tr>between citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8460.1" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: jus civile. </sense><sense id="n8460.2" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">private rights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the law</hi>, as it protects citizens in their status, property, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile est aequitas constituta iis, qui ejusdem civitatis sunt, ad res suas obtinendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit ergo in jure civili finis hic: legitimae atque usitatae in rebus causisque civium aequabilitatis conservatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jus civile contemnendum putat, is vincula revellit judiciorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. jus naturale: quodam tempore homines nondum neque naturali neque civili jure descripto fusi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8460.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The body of Roman law relating to private rights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Civil Law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis dicat jus civile id esse, quod in legibus, senatūs consultis, rebus judicatis, juris peritorum auctoritate, edictis magistratuum, more, aequitate consistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc civile (jus) quod dicimus (opp. causa universi juris ac legum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure civili si quis novi quid instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. jus nationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div in Caecil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. jus praetorium, the precedents of decisions by the prætor: nam quod agas mecum ex jure civili ac praetorio non habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl> pr. and § 1.—</sense><sense id="n8460.4" n="c" level="4"> In narrower sense, <hi rend="ital">the code of procedure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the forms of process</hi> in the Roman law: <cit><quote lang="la">civile jus, repositum in penetralibus pontificum, evulgavit (Licinius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile per multa saecula inter sacra caerimoniasque deorum abditum, Cn. Flavius vulgavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl> sqq.; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inteream si... novi civilia jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8460.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">political life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">political</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <trans><tr>politics</tr>, <tr>political science</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>, and 2, 4, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">civilium rerum peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersor civilibus undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: vir, <hi rend="ital">a statesman</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">politikos</foreign>, Quint. prooem. § 10; 11, 10, 15; 12, 2, 7; 12, 2, 21; 11, 1, 35.— </sense><sense id="n8460.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, opp. military (first in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">is gravis annis non militaribus solum sed civilibus quoque abscesserat muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis res haud magnopere obeuntem bella excitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8460.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. popularis, and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">koino/s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">demeaning one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self as a citizen;</hi> hence of distinguished persons, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urbane</hi> (so not before the Aug. per.; esp. freq. in Suet.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Quint. only once): quid enim civilius illo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumque id non civile modo sed humanum etiam visum,</quote> <trans><tr>unbecoming a private citizen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et humano ingressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 59</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">incessu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civile ingenium, mira comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 82</bibl>: arma, <cb n="CIVI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civile rebatur, misceri voluptatibus vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl>; 3, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 78, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:87:1" default="NO" valid="yes">87, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis circa amicos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cunctos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 20, 1</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam in vobis non dico civilis sed humani esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvīlĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n8460.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Citizen-like</hi>: vivere, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: certare, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 46, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 112</bibl>; Gell. praef. § 13.—</sense><sense id="n8460.9" n="b" level="4"> In judicial language, <hi rend="ital">civilly</hi> (opp. criminally): <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:1" default="NO">11, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:37" default="NO">47, 10, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8460.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to 2.) <hi rend="ital">As becomes a citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 583</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8461" type="main" key="Ci_vi_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīvīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, e. g. Julius Civilis, <hi rend="ital">chief of the Batavi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 13 sq.</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Civile, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
civilitas: <entryFree id="n8462" type="main" key="ci_vi_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>civilis</etym>. <sense id="n8462.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to civilis, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">The art of government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politics</hi>, only three times in Quint. as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">politikh/</foreign>, 2, 15, 25; 2, 15, 33; 2, 17, 14. —</sense><sense id="n8462.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to civilis, II.) <hi rend="ital">Courteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
civiliter: <entryFree id="n8463" type="main" key="ci_vi_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. civilis <sense id="n8463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
civis: <entryFree id="n8464" type="main" key="ci_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cīves</orth>, C. I. L. 3, 966; 3337 et saep.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ceivis</orth>, S. C. Bacch. and Lex Thoria; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ceus</orth> in Tab. Bant.), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<case>abl.</case> usually cive: <sense id="n8464.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">civi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13</bibl>, §§ 32 and 33 Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 11, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 766</bibl> P.; dub. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 52</bibl>) [root ki- of <foreign lang="greek">kei=mai</foreign>, to lie, abide; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kw/mh</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a citizen</hi> (male or female; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pe regrinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 35, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. advena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or to hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or to hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 234</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n8464.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n8464.2" n="a" level="4"> (Very freq. in all periods and kinds of composition.) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:174" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 174</bibl> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optati cives, populares, incolae, accolae, advenae omnes, Date viam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod civis cum civi agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives cum civibus de virtute certabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 2 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n8464.3" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 2 al.</bibl>: civis Romanus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> p. 2725</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 174 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 61, § 136</bibl>. —Concerning the political rights of the civis Romanus (opposed to peregrinus or hostis), v. Zimmern, Rechtsgesch. 2, § 123 sq.; Dict. of Antiq. p. 260 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n8464.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a fellow-citizen</hi> (for which, in late Lat., concivis): Lunaï portum cognoscite cives, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 9</bibl> (Ann. v. 16 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 234</bibl>.—So particularly, civis meus, tuus, etc., <hi rend="ital">my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thy fellow-citizen</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 10</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defende cives tuas, senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8464.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare corpori, ut rex civibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:25:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 25, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8464.6" n="III" level="1"> Figuratively: <cit><quote lang="la">civis totius mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>a citizen of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
civitas: <entryFree id="n8465" type="main" key="ci_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n8465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> civitatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 20, 11</bibl> Drak.; 42, 30, 6; 42, 44, 1; 45, 34, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl> Oud.; Cornut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8465.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut oratio Romana plane videatur, non civitate donata,</quote> <bibl
