N. 5:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 4</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8465.3" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the citizens united in a community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the body - politic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the state</hi>, and as this consists of one city and its territory, or of several cities, it differs from urbs, i.e. the compass of the dwellings of the collected citizens; <cit><quote lang="la">but sometimes meton., = urbs, v. B.: concilia coetusque hominum jure sociati, quae civitates appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum conventicula hominum, quae postea civitates nominatae sunt, tum domicilia conjuncta, quas urbes dicimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnis populus, qui est talis coetus multitudinis, qualem exposui; omnis civitas, quae est constitutio populi; <cit><quote lang="la">omnis res publica, quae populi res est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sapiens non sum, nec haec urbs nec in eā civitas ... non dubitavisset, quin et Roma urbs (esset), et eam civitas incoleret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aucta civitate magnitudine urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orgetorix civitati persuasit, ut de finibus suis cum omnibus copiis exirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit> Oud.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl>; 1, 19; 1, 31; cf. Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 429, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates aut nationes devictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">io triumphe non semel dicemus civitas omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 36</bibl> and 18: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civitas in foro exspectatione erecta staret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates aut condere novas aut conservare jam conditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis civitas Helvetia in quattuor pagos divisa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pars civitatis Helvetiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non longe a Tolosatium finibus, quae civitas est in provinciā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii, quorum fuit civitas ampla atque florens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodiorum civitas, magna atque magnifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 69, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclea quae est civitas aequissimo jure ac foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutari civitatum status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO">11, 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(legibus) solutis stare ipsa (civitas) non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:7" default="NO">12, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO">1, 2, 2</bibl>.—Of Plato's ideal republic: <cit><quote lang="la">si in illā commenticiā Platonis civitate res ageretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8465.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas caelitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam universus hic mundus una civitas sit communis deorum atque hominum existimanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8465.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, = urbs, <hi rend="ital">a city</hi> (rare and mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic. or Cæs.): civitatem incendere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 429, 5</bibl> (Trag. 382 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum errarem per totam civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>;
